<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>EXHIBIT F </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>[FORM OF CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER 
CERTIFICATE</B>]<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:56%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">[&#149;], 2014 </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">The undersigned, the Chief Executive Officer of 
Transocean Partners LLC, a limited liability company organized under the laws of
the Republic
of The Marshall Islands (the &#147;<B><I>Company</I></B>&#148;), pursuant to 
Section&nbsp;6[&nbsp;] of that certain Underwriting Agreement dated 
July&nbsp;31, 2014 (the &#147;<B><I>Underwriting Agreement</I></B>&#148;), by 
and among the Company, the
Transocean Member, the Rig Companies and Morgan Stanley&nbsp;&amp; Co. 
Incorporated and Barclays Capital Inc., as the representatives of the 
underwriters named therein (the &#147;<B><I>Underwriters</I></B>&#148;), hereby
certifies, based on an
examination of the internal accounting records of the Company undertaken by her 
and members of Transocean Ltd.&#146;s staff who are responsible for the 
Company&#146;s financial and accounting matters, that as of the date hereof: 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">1. To her knowledge, for the period
from April&nbsp;1 2014 through June&nbsp;30, 2014, there was no material 
decrease in
operating income, as compared to the corresponding period in the preceding year.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">2. This certificate is 
given to assist
the underwriters in conducting and documenting their investigation of the 
affairs of the Company in connection with the offering of the Units as proposed 
in the Underwriting Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise 
defined shall have the same meaning ascribed to such terms in the Underwriting 
Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has executed 
this certificate this [&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;]th day of
[&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;], 
2014. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="40%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-
COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">/s/ Kathleen S. 
McAllister</TD></TR>

<TR STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">
<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="6" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE VIII</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1pt">

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">v </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY AGREEMENT OF </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>TRANSOCEAN PARTNERS LLC </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">THIS SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED LIMITED LIABILITY 
COMPANY AGREEMENT OF TRANSOCEAN PARTNERS LLC, dated as of July&nbsp;29, 2014, is
entered
into by Transocean Partners Holdings Limited, a Cayman Islands exempted company,
together with any other Persons who become Members in the Company or parties 
hereto as provided herein. In consideration of the covenants, conditions and 
agreements
contained herein, the parties agree as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE I </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">Section 1.1
<I>Definitions</I>. The following definitions shall be for all purposes, unless 
otherwise clearly indicated to the contrary, applied to the terms used in this 
Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Adjusted Operating 
Surplus</I>&#148; means, with respect to any period, Operating Surplus generated
with respect to such
period: (a)&nbsp;<I>less</I> (i)&nbsp;the amount of any net increase in Working 
Capital Borrowings (or the Company&#146;s proportionate share of any net 
increase in Working Capital Borrowings in the case of Subsidiaries that are not 
wholly owned)
with respect to such period and (ii)&nbsp;the amount of any net decrease in cash
reserves for Operating Expenditures (or the Company&#146;s proportionate share 
of any net decrease in cash reserves for Operating Expenditures in the case of
Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) with respect to such period not relating
to an Operating Expenditure made with respect to such period, and 
(b)&nbsp;<I>plus</I> (i)&nbsp;the amount of any net decrease in Working Capital 
Borrowings (or the
Company&#146;s proportionate share of any net decrease in Working Capital 
Borrowings in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) with respect 
to such period; (ii)&nbsp;the amount of any net increase in cash reserves (or 
the Company&#146;s
proportionate share of any net increase in cash reserves in the case of 
Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) for Operating Expenditures required by 
any debt instrument for the repayment of principal, interest or premium; and 
(iii)&nbsp;the amount
of any net decrease made in subsequent periods to cash reserves for Operating 
Expenditures initially established with respect to such period to the extent 
such decrease results in a reduction in Adjusted Operating Surplus in subsequent
periods
pursuant to clause (a)(ii) above. Adjusted Operating Surplus does not include 
that portion of Operating Surplus included in clause (a)(i) of the definition of
Operating Surplus. To the extent that disbursements made, cash received or cash 
reserves
established, increased or reduced after the end of a period are included in the 
determination of Operating Surplus for such period (as contemplated by the 
proviso in the definition of &#147;Operating Surplus&#148;) such disbursements, 
cash receipts
and changes in cash reserves shall be deemed to have occurred in such period 
(and not in any future period) for purposes of calculating increases or 
decreases in Working Capital Borrowings or cash reserves during such period.<I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Affiliate</I>&#148; means (except 
with respect to Section&nbsp;14.7), with respect to any Person, any other Person
that
directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries controls, is 
controlled by or is under common control with, the Person in question. As used 
herein, the term &#147;control&#148; <I></I>means the possession, direct or 
indirect, of the power
to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a Person, 
whether through ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.<I> 
</I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">1 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Agreed Value</I>&#148; means the 
fair market value of the applicable property or
other consideration at the time of contribution or distribution, as the case may
be, as determined by the Board of Directors. The Board of Directors shall use 
such methods as it determines to be appropriate to allocate the aggregate Agreed
Value of
Contributed Properties contributed to the Company Group in a single or 
integrated transaction among each separate property on a basis proportional to 
the fair market value of each Contributed Property.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Agreement</I>&#148; means this 
Second Amended and Restated Limited Liability Company Agreement of Transocean 
Partners LLC, as
it may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to time.<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Annual Meeting</I>&#148; means the 
meeting of
Members to be held every year, commencing in 2015, to elect the Elected 
Directors as provided in Section 7.2 and to vote on any other matters brought 
before the meeting in accordance with this Agreement.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Appointed Directors</I>&#148; means
the members of the Board of Directors appointed by the Transocean Member in 
accordance
with the provisions of Article VII.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Associate</I>&#148; means, when used to indicate a 
relationship with any
Person: (a)&nbsp;any corporation or organization of which such Person is a 
director, officer, manager, general partner or managing member or is, directly 
or indirectly, the owner of 20% or more of any class of voting stock or other 
voting interest
entitled to vote generally in the election of directors or other governing body 
of such entity; (b)&nbsp;any trust or other estate in which such Person has at 
least a 20% beneficial interest or as to which such Person serves as trustee or 
in a
similar fiduciary capacity; and (c)&nbsp;any relative or spouse of such Person, 
or any relative of such spouse, who has the same principal residence as such 
Person.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Audit Committee</I>&#148; means the
audit committee of the Board of Directors, which shall be composed of a minimum 
of three
members of the Board of Directors then serving who meet the independence 
standards required of directors who serve on an audit committee of a board of 
directors established by the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations of the 
Commission
thereunder and meet the standards for audit committee composition established by
the National Securities Exchange on which the Common Units are listed or 
admitted to trading.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Available Cash</I>&#148; means, 
with respect to any Quarter ending prior to the Liquidation Date: <I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) the sum of (i)&nbsp;all cash 
and cash equivalents of the Company Group (or the Company&#146;s proportionate 
share of cash
and cash equivalents in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) on 
hand at the end of such Quarter, (ii)&nbsp;if the Board of Directors so 
determines, all or any portion of additional cash and cash equivalents of the 
Company Group (or
the Company&#146;s proportionate share of cash and cash equivalents in the case 
of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) on hand on the date of determination 
of Available Cash with respect to such Quarter resulting from Working Capital
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New
Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I>
</I>Borrowings made subsequent to the end of such Quarter, and (iii)&nbsp;all 
cash and cash equivalents on hand on the date of determination of Available Cash
resulting from cash distributions
received after the end of such Quarter from any Group Member&#146;s equity 
interest in any Person (other than a Subsidiary), which distributions are paid 
by such Person in respect of operations conducted by such Person during such 
Quarter, <I>less
</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>(b) the amount of
any cash reserves (or the Company&#146;s proportionate share of cash reserves in
the case of
Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) established by the Board of Directors to
(i)&nbsp;provide for the proper conduct of the business of the Company Group 
(including reserves for future capital expenditures and for anticipated future 
debt service
requirements of the Company Group) subsequent to such Quarter, (ii)&nbsp;comply 
with applicable law or any loan agreement, security agreement, mortgage, debt 
instrument or other agreement or obligation to which any Group Member is a party
or by
which it is bound or its assets are subject and (iii)&nbsp;provide funds for 
distributions under Sections 6.2 or 6.3 in respect of any one or more of the 
next four Quarters; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that the Board of Directors
may not
establish cash reserves pursuant to (iii)&nbsp;above if the effect of 
establishing such reserves would be that the Company is unable to distribute the
Minimum Quarterly Distribution on all Common Units, plus any Cumulative Common 
Unit Arrearage on
all Common Units, with respect to such Quarter; and, <I>provided further</I>, 
that disbursements made by a Group Member or cash reserves established, 
increased or reduced after the end of such Quarter but on or before the date of 
determination of
Available Cash with respect to such Quarter shall be deemed to have been made, 
established, increased or reduced, for purposes of determining Available Cash, 
within such Quarter if the Board of Directors so determines.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Notwithstanding the foregoing, &#147;Available 
Cash&#148; with respect to the Quarter in which the Liquidation Date occurs and 
any subsequent
Quarter shall equal zero. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Board of Directors</I>&#148; means the board of directors
of the Company, composed of Appointed
Directors and Elected Directors appointed or elected, as the case may be, in 
accordance with the provisions of Article VII, a majority of whom are U.K. Tax 
Residents, which pursuant to Section 7.1 oversees and directs the operations, 
management and
policies of the Company.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Business Day</I>&#148; means Monday through Friday of 
each week, except that a legal
holiday recognized as such by the government of the United States of America or 
the State of Texas shall not be regarded as a Business Day.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Capital Contribution</I>&#148; 
means (a)&nbsp;any cash, cash equivalents or the Net Agreed Value of Contributed
Property that
a Member contributes to the Company or that is contributed, directly or
indirectly, to the Company on behalf of a Member (including in the case of an 
underwritten offering of Units, the amount of any underwriting discounts or 
commissions) or
(b)&nbsp;the current distributions that a Member is entitled to receive but 
otherwise waives.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Capital
Improvement</I>&#148; means (a)&nbsp;the acquisition (through an asset 
acquisition, merger, stock acquisition or other form of investment) by any Group
Member of existing assets or assets under construction, (b)&nbsp;the 
construction or development
of new capital assets by a Group <I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">3 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
Member, (c)&nbsp;the replacement or expansion of, or addition or improvement to,
existing capital assets by a Group Member or (d)&nbsp;a capital contribution by 
a Group Member to a Person that is
not a Subsidiary in which a Group Member has, or after such capital contribution
will have, directly or indirectly, an equity interest, to fund such Group 
Member&#146;s pro rata share of the cost of the acquisition, construction, 
development,
replacement or expansion of, or addition or improvement to, capital assets by 
such Person, in each case if and to the extent such acquisition, construction, 
development, replacement, expansion, addition or improvement is made to 
increase, over the
long term, the operating capacity, asset base or operating income of the Company
Group, in the case of clauses (a), (b)&nbsp;and (c), or such Person, in the case
of clause (d), from the operating capacity, asset base or operating income of 
the
Company Group or such Person, as the case may be, existing immediately prior to 
such acquisition, construction, development, replacement, expansion, addition, 
improvement or Capital Contribution. For purposes of this definition, &#147;long
term&#148; generally refers to a period of not less than 12 months. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Capital Surplus</I>&#148; has the 
meaning assigned to
such term in Section 6.1(a).<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Cause</I>&#148; means, with respect to a director or 
officer, a court of competent
jurisdiction has entered a final, non-appealable judgment finding such director 
or officer, as the case may be, liable for actual fraud or willful misconduct in
such director&#146;s or officer&#146;s capacity as a director or officer and 
with
respect to the Transocean Member, a court of competent jurisdiction has entered 
a final, non-appealable judgment finding the Transocean Member liable for actual
fraud or willful misconduct against the Company or its Members, in their 
capacity as
such.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Certificate</I>&#148; means a certificate in such form 
(including global form if permitted by applicable
rules and regulations) as may be adopted by the Board of Directors, issued by 
the Company evidencing ownership of one or more Membership Interests. The 
initial form of certificate approved by the Board of Directors for Common Units 
is attached as
Exhibit A to this Agreement.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Certificate of Formation</I>&#148; means the Certificate 
of Formation of the Company
filed with the Registrar of Corporations of the Marshall Islands, as such 
Certificate of Formation may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to 
time.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Claim</I>&#148; (as used in Section
7.20(g)(i)) has the meaning assigned to such term in Section 7.20(g)(i).<I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Closing Date</I>&#148; means the 
first date on which Common Units are sold by the Transocean Member to the 
Underwriters
pursuant to the provisions of the Underwriting Agreement.<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Closing Price</I>&#148; means, in 
respect of any class
of Membership Interests, as of the date of determination, the last sale price on
such day, regular way, or in case no such sale takes place on such day, the 
average of the closing bid and asked prices on such day, regular way, as 
reported in the
principal consolidated transaction reporting system with respect to securities 
listed or admitted to trading on the principal National Securities Exchange on 
which the respective Membership Interests are listed or admitted to trading or, 
if such
Membership Interests are not listed or admitted to trading on any National 
Securities Exchange, the last quoted price on such day or, if not so quoted, the
average of the high bid and low asked prices on such day in the
over-<I></I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
the-counter market, as reported by any quotation system then in use with respect
to such Membership Interests, or, if on any such day such Membership Interests 
of such class are not quoted by any
such system, the average of the closing bid and asked prices on such day as 
furnished by a professional market maker making a market in such Membership 
Interests of such class selected by the Board of Directors, or if on any such 
day no market maker
is making a market in such Membership Interests of such class, the fair value of
such Membership Interests on such day as determined by the Board of Directors. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Combined Interest</I>&#148; has the
meaning assigned to such term in Section 11.3(a).<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Commences Commercial 
Service</I>&#148; and &#147;<I>Commenced Commercial Service</I>&#148; shall mean
the date upon which a
Capital Improvement is first put into commercial service by a Group Member (or 
other Person that is not a Subsidiary of a Group Member, as contemplated in the 
definition of &#147;Capital Improvement&#148;) following completion of 
acquisition,
construction, development, replacement, expansion, addition, improvement and 
testing, as applicable.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Commission</I>&#148; means the
United States Securities and Exchange Commission.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Common Unit</I>&#148; means a 
Membership Interest having the rights and obligations specified with respect to 
Common Units in
this Agreement. The term &#147;Common Unit&#148; does not include any 
Subordinated Unit prior to its conversion into a Common Unit pursuant to the 
terms hereof.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Common Unit Arrearage</I>&#148; 
means, with respect to any Common Unit, whenever issued, as to any Quarter 
wholly within the
Subordination Period, the excess, if any, of (a)&nbsp;the Minimum Quarterly 
Distribution with respect to a Common Unit in respect of such Quarter over 
(b)&nbsp;the sum of all Available Cash distributed with respect to a Common Unit
in respect of
such Quarter pursuant to Section 6.2(a)(i).<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Company</I>&#148; means Transocean Partners LLC, a 
Marshall Islands
limited liability company, and any successors thereto.<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Company Group</I>&#148; means the 
Company and its
Subsidiaries, treated as a single consolidated entity.<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Conflicts Committee</I>&#148; means a 
committee of the
Board of Directors composed entirely of two or more members of the Board of 
Directors, a majority of whom are U.K. Tax Residents, each of whom: (a)&nbsp;is 
not an officer, director (other than a director of any Group Member), manager or
employee of
the Transocean Member or any Affiliate of the Transocean Member, (b)&nbsp;is not
a holder of any ownership interest in the Company Group (other than Common Units
or awards granted to such director under any long-term incentive plan of any 
Group
Member) or in the Transocean Member or any Affiliate of the Transocean Member 
and (c)&nbsp;meets the independence standards required of directors who serve on
an audit committee of a board of directors established by the Exchange Act and 
the rules
and regulations of the Commission thereunder and by the National Securities 
Exchange on which any class of Membership Interests is listed or admitted to 
trading (or if the Common Units are not listed or admitted to trading, the New 
York Stock
Exchange).<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<I>Construction Debt</I>&#148; means debt 
incurred to fund (a)&nbsp;all or a portion of a
Capital Improvement or replacement asset, (b)&nbsp;interest payments (including 
periodic net payments under related interest rate swap agreements) and related 
fees on other Construction Debt or (c)&nbsp;distributions paid in respect of 
Construction
Equity, and incremental Incentive Distributions in respect thereof. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">&#147;<I>Construction Equity</I>&#148; means equity 
issued to fund
(a)&nbsp;all or a portion of a Capital Improvement or replacement asset,
(b)&nbsp;interest payments (including periodic net payments under related 
interest rate swap agreements) and related fees on Construction Debt or 
(c)&nbsp;distributions paid in
respect of Construction Equity, and incremental Incentive Distributions in 
respect thereof. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<I>Construction 
Period</I>&#148; means
the period beginning on the date that a Group Member (or other Person that is 
not a Subsidiary of a Group Member, as contemplated in the definition of 
&#147;Capital Improvement&#148;) enters into a binding obligation to commence a 
Capital
Improvement or replacement asset and ending on the earlier to occur of the date 
that such Capital Improvement or replacement asset Commences Commercial Service 
and the date that the Group Member (or other Person that is not a Subsidiary of 
a Group
Member, as contemplated in the definition of &#147;Capital Improvement&#148;) 
abandons or disposes of such Capital Improvement or replacement asset. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Contributed Property</I>&#148; 
means each property or other asset, in such form as may be permitted by the 
Marshall Islands
Act, but excluding cash, contributed to the Company.<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Contribution Agreement</I>&#148; means 
that certain
Contribution, Conveyance and Assumption Agreement, dated as of July&nbsp;29, 
2014, among the Transocean Member and the Company, together with the additional 
conveyance documents and instruments contemplated or referenced thereunder or 
entered into
in connection therewith, as such may be amended, supplemented or restated from 
time to time.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Credit
Agreement</I>&#148; means that certain Credit Agreement, dated as of the Closing
Date, between the Company, as borrower, and Transocean Financing GmbH, as 
lender.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Cumulative Common Unit 
Arrearage</I>&#148; means, with respect to any Common Unit, whenever issued, and
as of the end of any
Quarter, the excess, if any, of (a)&nbsp;the sum of the Common Unit Arrearage as
to an Initial Common Unit for each of the Quarters within the Subordination 
Period ending on or before the last day of such Quarter over (b)&nbsp;the sum of
any
distributions theretofore made pursuant to Section 6.2(a)(ii) and Section 6.3(b)
with respect to an Initial Common Unit (including any distributions to be made 
in respect of the last of such Quarters).<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Cumulative Voting Request</I>&#148;
has the meaning assigned to such term in Section 7.2(d)(ii).<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Current Market Price</I>&#148; 
means, in respect of any class of Membership Interests, as of the date of 
determination, the
average of the daily Closing Prices per Membership Interest of such class for 
the 20 consecutive Trading Days immediately prior to such date.<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">6 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Departing Transocean
Member</I>&#148; means a former Transocean Member from and
after the effective date of any withdrawal or removal of such former Transocean 
Member pursuant to Sections&nbsp;11.1 or 11.2.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Derivative Instrument</I>&#148; has
the meaning assigned to such term in Section 13.9(b)(iii).<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Derivative Membership 
Interests</I>&#148; means any options, rights, warrants, appreciation rights, 
tracking, profit and
phantom interests and other derivative securities relating to, convertible into 
or exchangeable for Membership Interests.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Elected Directors</I>&#148; means 
the members of the Board of Directors who are elected as such in accordance with
the
provisions of Article VII, subject to the terms and conditions of this 
Agreement. <I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Estimated Maintenance Capital
Expenditures</I>&#148; means an estimate made in good faith by the Board of 
Directors (with the concurrence of the Conflicts Committee) of the average 
quarterly Maintenance Capital Expenditures that the Company will need to incur 
to maintain, over
the long term, the operating capacity, asset base or operating income of the 
Company Group (including the Company&#146;s proportionate share of the average 
quarterly Maintenance Capital Expenditures of its Subsidiaries that are not 
wholly owned,
including the Rig Companies) existing at the time the estimate is made. The 
Board of Directors (with the concurrence of the Conflicts Committee) will be 
permitted to make such estimate in any manner it determines reasonable. The 
estimate will be
made at least annually and whenever an event occurs that is likely to result in 
a material adjustment to the amount of future Estimated Maintenance Capital 
Expenditures. The Company shall disclose to its Members any change in the amount
of Estimated
Maintenance Capital Expenditures in its reports made in accordance with Section 
8.3 to the extent not previously disclosed. Any adjustments to Estimated 
Maintenance Capital Expenditures shall be prospective only. For purposes of this
definition,
&#147;long term&#148; generally refers to a period of not less than 12 
months.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Event of
Withdrawal</I>&#148; has
the meaning assigned to such term in Section 11.1(a).<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Exchange Act</I>&#148; means the 
Securities Exchange Act
of&nbsp;1934, as amended.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Expansion Capital Expenditures</I>&#148; means cash 
expenditures (including transaction
expenses) for Capital Improvements and shall not include Maintenance Capital 
Expenditures or Investment Capital Expenditures. Expansion Capital Expenditures 
shall include interest payments (including periodic net payments under related 
interest rate
swap agreements) and related fees on Construction Debt to fund Expansion Capital
Expenditures and paid in respect of the Construction Period. Where cash 
expenditures are made in part for Expansion Capital Expenditures and in part for
other purposes,
the Board of Directors shall determine the allocation between the amounts paid 
for each. <I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>First 
Target
Distribution</I>&#148; means $0.416875 per Unit per Quarter (or, with respect to
the period commencing on the Closing Date and ending on September&nbsp;30, 2014,
it means the product of $0.416875 multiplied by a fraction of which the 
numerator is
the number of days in such period, and of which the denominator is the total 
number of days in the Quarter in which the Closing Date occurs), subject to 
adjustment in accordance with Section 6.4.<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">7 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Fully Diluted Weighted Average 
Basis</I>&#148; means, when calculating the number
of Outstanding Units for any period, the sum of (1)&nbsp;the weighted-average 
number of Outstanding Units during such period plus (2)&nbsp;all Membership 
Interests and Derivative Membership Interests (a)&nbsp;that are convertible into
or exercisable
or exchangeable for Units or for which Units are issuable, in each case that are
senior to or <I>pari passu</I> with the Subordinated Units, (b)&nbsp;whose 
conversion, exercise or exchange price is less than the Current Market Price on 
the date of
such calculation, (c)&nbsp;that may be converted into or exercised or exchanged 
for such Units prior to or during the Quarter immediately following the end of 
the period for which the calculation is being made without the satisfaction of 
any
contingency beyond the control of the holder other than the payment of 
consideration and the compliance with administrative mechanics applicable to 
such conversion, exercise or exchange and (d)&nbsp;that were not converted into 
or exercised or
exchanged for such Units during the period for which the calculation is being 
made; <I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that for purposes of determining the 
number of Outstanding Units on a Fully Diluted Weighted Average Basis when 
calculating whether
the Subordination Period has ended, such Membership Interests and Derivative 
Membership Interests shall be deemed to have been Outstanding Units only for the
four Quarters that comprise the last four Quarters of the measurement period; 
and
<I>provided</I>, <I>further</I>, that if consideration will be paid to any Group
Member in connection with such conversion, exercise or exchange, the number of 
Units to be included in such calculation shall be that number equal to the 
difference
between (i)&nbsp;the number of Units issuable upon such conversion, exercise or 
exchange and (ii)&nbsp;the number of Units that such consideration would 
purchase at the Current Market Price.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Group</I>&#148; means two or more 
Persons that with or through any of their respective Affiliates or Associates 
have any
contract, arrangement, understanding or relationship for the purpose of 
acquiring, holding, voting (except voting pursuant to a revocable proxy or 
consent given to such Person in response to a proxy or consent solicitation made
to 10 or more
Persons), exercising investment power or disposing of any Membership Interests 
with any other Person that beneficially owns, or whose Affiliates or Associates 
beneficially own, directly or indirectly, Membership Interests<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Group Member</I>&#148; means a 
member of the Company Group.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Group Member Agreement</I>&#148;
means the partnership agreement of any Group Member that is a limited or general
partnership,
the limited liability company agreement of any Group Member that is a limited 
liability company, other than the Company, the certificate of incorporation and 
bylaws (or similar organizational documents) of any Group Member that is a 
corporation, the
joint venture agreement or similar governing document of any Group Member that 
is a joint venture and the governing or organizational or similar documents of 
any other Group Member that is a Person other than a limited or general 
partnership,
limited liability company, corporation or joint venture, in each case as such 
may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to time.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Hedge Contract</I>&#148; means any 
exchange, swap, forward, future, cap, floor, collar or other similar agreement 
or
arrangement entered into for the purpose of hedging the Company Group&#146;s 
exposure to fluctuations in the price of interest rates, currencies or 
commodities in their operations or financing activities, in each case other than
not for speculative
purposes.<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">8 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Holder</I>&#148; means any of the 
following:<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) the Transocean Member who is 
the Record Holder of Registrable Securities; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) any Affiliate of the Transocean
Member who is the Record Holder of Registrable Securities (other than natural 
persons who
are Affiliates of the Transocean Member by virtue of being officers, directors 
or employees of the Transocean Member or any of its Affiliates); </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) any Person who has been the 
Transocean Member within the prior two years and who is the Record Holder of 
Registrable
Securities; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) any Person who 
has been an Affiliate of the Transocean Member within the prior two years and 
who is the
Record Holder of Registrable Securities (other than natural persons who were 
Affiliates of the Transocean Member by virtue of being officers, directors or 
employees of the Transocean Member or any of its Affiliates); and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>(e) a transferee and current
Record Holder of Registrable Securities to whom the transferor of such 
Registrable
Securities, who was a Holder at the time of such transfer, assigns its rights 
and obligations under this Agreement; <I>provided</I> such transferee agrees in 
writing to comply with all applicable requirements and obligations in connection
with the
registration and disposition of such Registrable Securities pursuant to Section 
7.20.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Holding 
Companies</I>&#148;
means, collectively, Triton RIGP DIN Holdings Ltd., Triton RIGP DCL Holdings
Ltd., Triton RIGP DD3 Holdings Ltd., Transocean RIGP DIN Opco Ltd., Transocean 
RIGP DCL Opco Ltd., Transocean RIGP DD3 Opco Ltd. and any successor thereto <I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Incentive Distribution 
Right</I>&#148; means a Membership Interest having the rights and obligations 
specified with respect to
Incentive Distribution Rights in this Agreement.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Incentive Distributions</I>&#148; means any amount of
cash
distributed to the holders of the Incentive Distribution Rights pursuant to 
Section 6.2.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Indemnified
Persons</I>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in Section 7.20(g)
(i).<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Indemnitee</I>&#148; means
(a)&nbsp;the Transocean Member, (b)&nbsp;any Departing Transocean Member, 
(c)&nbsp;any Person who is or was an Affiliate of the Transocean Member or any 
Departing Transocean Member, (d)&nbsp;any Person who is or was a managing 
member, manager,
general partner, director, officer, fiduciary or trustee of any Group Member, 
the Transocean Member, any Departing Transocean Member or any of their 
respective Affiliates, (e)&nbsp;any Person who is or was serving at the request 
of the Board of
Directors, the Transocean Member or any Departing Transocean Member or any 
Affiliate of the Transocean Member or any Departing Transocean Member as a 
managing member, manager, general partner, director, officer, fiduciary or 
trustee of another
Person owing a fiduciary or similar duty to any Group Member (<I>provided</I>, 
<I>however</I>, that a Person shall not be an Indemnitee by reason of providing,
on a fee-for-services basis, trustee, fiduciary or custodial services), and 
(f)&nbsp;any
other Person the Board of Directors <I></I>designates as an 
&#147;Indemnitee&#148; for purposes of this Agreement because such Person&#146;s
service, status or relationship exposes such Person to potential claims, 
demands, actions, suits or
proceedings relating to the Company Group&#146;s business and affairs.<I> 
</I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">9 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Initial Common Unit</I>&#148; means
a Common Unit sold in the Initial Public
Offering.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Initial 
Non-Transocean Members</I>&#148; means the Transocean Member (with respect to 
the Common Units,
Subordinated Units and Incentive Distribution Rights received by the Transocean 
Member) and the Underwriters, in each case upon being admitted as Members to the
Company in accordance with Section 10.1.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Initial Public Offering</I>&#148; 
means the initial public offering and sale of Common Units to the public, as 
described in
the IPO Registration Statement, including any Common Units sold pursuant to the 
exercise of the Underwriters&#146; Option.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Initial Transocean Member</I>&#148;
means Transocean Partners Holdings Limited.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Initial Unit Price</I>&#148; means 
(a)&nbsp;with respect to the Common Units and the Subordinated Units, the 
initial public
offering price per Common Unit at which the Underwriters offered the Common 
Units to the public for sale as set forth on the cover page of the prospectus 
included as part of the IPO Registration Statement and first issued at or after 
the time the
IPO Registration Statement first became effective or (b)&nbsp;with respect to 
any other class or series of Units, the price per Unit at which such class or 
series of Units is initially sold by the Company, as determined by the Board of 
Directors, in
each case adjusted as the Board of Directors determines to be appropriate to 
give effect to any distribution, subdivision or combination of Units.<I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Interim Capital 
Transactions</I>&#148; means the following transactions if they occur prior to 
the Liquidation Date:
(a)&nbsp;borrowings, refinancings or refundings of indebtedness (other than 
Working Capital Borrowings and other than for items purchased on open account or
for a deferred purchase price in the ordinary course of business) by any Group 
Member and
sales of debt securities of any Group Member; (b)&nbsp;issuances of equity 
interests of any Group Member to anyone other than the Company Group; 
(c)&nbsp;sales or other voluntary or involuntary dispositions of any assets of 
any Group Member
(including assets acquired using Investment Capital Expenditures) other than 
(i)&nbsp;sales or other dispositions of inventory, accounts receivable and other
assets in the ordinary course of business and (ii)&nbsp;sales or other 
dispositions of
assets as part of normal retirements or replacements; and (d)&nbsp;capital 
contributions received.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Investment
Capital Expenditures</I>&#148; means capital expenditures other than Maintenance
Capital Expenditures and Expansion Capital Expenditures.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>IPO Registration 
Statement</I>&#148; means the Registration Statement on Form&nbsp;S-1 
(Registration No.&nbsp;333-196958) as
it has been or as it may be amended or supplemented from time to time, filed by 
the Company with the Commission under the Securities Act to register the 
offering and sale of the Common Units in the Initial Public Offering.<I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Liquidator</I>&#148; means one or 
more Persons selected by the Board of Directors to perform the functions 
described in
Section 12.4.<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">10 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Liquidation Date</I>&#148; means 
(a)&nbsp;in the case of an event giving rise to
the dissolution of the Company of the type described in clauses&nbsp;(a)
and&nbsp;(b) of the first sentence of Section 12.2, the date on which the 
applicable time period during which the holders of Outstanding Units have the 
right to elect to
continue the business of the Company has expired without such an election being 
made, and (b)&nbsp;in the case of any other event giving rise to the dissolution
of the Company, the date on which such event occurs.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Maintenance Capital 
Expenditures</I>&#148; means cash expenditures (including expenditures for 
(a)&nbsp;the acquisition
(through an asset acquisition, merger, stock acquisition or other form of 
investment) by any Group Member of existing assets or assets under construction,
(b)&nbsp;the construction or development of new capital assets by a Group 
Member, (c)&nbsp;the
replacement or expansion of, or addition or improvement to, existing capital 
assets by a Group Member or (d)&nbsp;a capital contribution by a Group Member to
a Person that is not a Subsidiary in which a Group Member has, or after such 
capital
contribution will have, directly or indirectly, an equity interest, to fund such
Group Member&#146;s pro rata share of the cost of the acquisition, construction,
development, replacement or expansion of, or addition or improvement to, capital
assets
by such Person), in each case if and to the extent such acquisition, 
construction, development, expansion, addition or improvement is made to 
maintain, over the long term, the operating capacity, asset base or operating 
income of the Company Group,
in the case of clauses (a), (b)&nbsp;and (c), or such Person, in the case of 
clause (d). Maintenance Capital Expenditures shall include interest payments 
(including periodic net payments under related interest rate swap agreements) 
and related fees
on Construction Debt to fund replacement assets and paid in respect of the 
Construction Period and the amount of cash distributions paid in respect of 
Construction Equity to fund replacement assets (and incremental Incentive 
Distributions in respect
thereof) and paid in respect of the Construction Period. For purposes of this 
definition, &#147;long term&#148; generally refers to a period of not less than 
12 months.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Marshall Islands Act</I>&#148; 
means the Limited Liability Company Act of 1996 of the Republic of the Marshall 
Islands, as
amended, supplemented or restated from time to time, and any successor to such 
statute.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Master 
Services
Agreements</I>&#148; means the Master Services Agreements, dated as of the 
Closing Date, among the Company, certain of its Subsidiaries and certain 
Affiliates of Transocean.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Members</I>&#148; means the 
Transocean Member and the Non-Transocean Members.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Membership Interest</I>&#148; means
any class or series of equity interest in the Company (but excluding Derivative 
Membership
Interests), including Common Units, Subordinated Units, the Transocean Member 
Interest and Incentive Distribution Rights.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Merger Agreement</I>&#148; has the 
meaning assigned to such term in Section 14.1.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<I>Minimum Quarterly Distribution</I>&#148; 
means $0.3625 per Unit per Quarter (or with respect to the period commencing on 
the Closing
Date and ending on September&nbsp;30, 2014, it means the product of $0.3625 
multiplied by a fraction of which the numerator is the number of days in such 
period and of which the denominator is the total number of days in the Quarter 
in which the
Closing Date occurs), subject to adjustment in accordance with Section 6.4. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">11 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>National Securities 
Exchange</I>&#148; means an exchange registered with the
Commission under Section&nbsp;6(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as 
amended, supplemented or restated from time to time, and any successor to such 
statute.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Net Agreed Value</I>&#148; means, 
(a)&nbsp;in the case of any Contributed Property, the Agreed Value of such 
property reduced
by any liabilities either assumed by the Company upon such contribution or to 
which such property is subject when contributed, and (b)&nbsp;in the case of any
property distributed to a Member by the Company, the Agreed Value of such 
property,
reduced by any indebtedness either assumed by such Member upon such distribution
or to which such property is subject at the time of distribution.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Non-Transocean Member</I>&#148; 
means, unless the context otherwise requires, each Initial Non-Transocean 
Member, each Person
that becomes a Non-Transocean Member pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and
any Departing Transocean Member upon the change of its status from Transocean 
Member to Non-Transocean Member pursuant to Section 11.3, in each case, in such
Person&#146;s capacity as a Non-Transocean Member. Non-Transocean Members may 
include custodians, nominees or any other individual or entity in its own or any
representative capacity. For the avoidance of doubt, the Transocean Member shall
be a
Non-Transocean Member for all purposes of this Agreement with respect to any 
Non-Transocean Member Interest.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Non-Transocean Member 
Interest</I>&#148; means the ownership interest of a Member in the Company, 
which may be evidenced by
Common Units, Subordinated Units, Incentive Distribution Rights or other 
Membership Interests or a combination thereof or interest therein, and includes 
any and all benefits to which such Member is entitled as provided in this 
Agreement, together
with all obligations of such Member to comply with the terms and provisions of 
this Agreement, but in each case shall not include the Transocean Member 
Interest.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Notice</I>&#148; means a written 
request from a Holder pursuant to Section 7.20 which shall (i)&nbsp;specify the 
Registrable
Securities intended to be registered, offered and sold by such Holder, 
(ii)&nbsp;describe the nature or method of the proposed offer and sale of 
Registrable Securities, and (iii)&nbsp;contain the undertaking of such Holder to
provide all such
information and materials and take all action as may be required or appropriate 
in order to permit the Company to comply with all applicable requirements and 
obligations in connection with the registration and disposition of such 
Registrable
Securities pursuant to Section 7.20.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Notice of Election to Purchase</I>&#148; has the meaning 
assigned to such
term in Section 15.1(b).<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Officers</I>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term 
in Section 7.8(a).<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Omnibus Agreement</I>&#148; means 
that Omnibus Agreement, dated as of the Closing Date, among Transocean Ltd., 
Transocean
Inc., the Company, the Transocean Member and the Rig Companies.<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">12 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Operating Expenditures</I>&#148; 
means all Company Group expenditures (or the
Company&#146;s proportionate share of expenditures in the case of Subsidiaries 
that are not wholly owned), including taxes; officer, employee and director 
compensation; reimbursements of expenses of the Transocean Member and its 
Affiliates;
repayment of Working Capital Borrowings; interest payments on indebtedness; 
Estimated Maintenance Capital Expenditures; and payments made in the ordinary 
course of business under any Hedge Contracts, subject to the following:<I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) repayments of Working Capital 
Borrowings deducted from Operating Surplus pursuant to clause (b)(iii) of the 
definition of
Operating Surplus shall not constitute Operating Expenditures when actually 
repaid; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) payments (including 
prepayments
and prepayment penalties and the purchase price of indebtedness that is 
repurchased and cancelled) of principal of and premium on indebtedness other 
than Working Capital Borrowings shall not constitute Operating Expenditures; 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) Operating Expenditures shall 
not include any of (i)&nbsp;Expansion Capital Expenditures, Investment Capital 
Expenditures or
actual Maintenance Capital Expenditures, (ii)&nbsp;payment of transaction 
expenses (including taxes) relating to Interim Capital Transactions, 
(iii)&nbsp;distributions to Members or (iv)&nbsp;repurchases of Membership 
Interests, other than
repurchases of Membership Interests by the Company to satisfy obligations under 
employee benefit plans; and </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d)
(i)
payments made in connection with the initial purchase of any Hedge Contract 
shall be amortized over the life of such Hedge Contract and (ii)&nbsp;payments 
made in connection with the termination of any Hedge Contract prior to its 
stipulated
settlement or termination date shall be included in equal quarterly installments
over what would have been the remaining schedule term of such Hedge Contract had
it not been so terminated. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">Where capital expenditures consist of both
(x)&nbsp;Maintenance Capital Expenditures and (y)&nbsp;Expansion Capital 
Expenditures and/or
Investment Capital Expenditures, the Board of Directors shall determine the 
allocation between the amounts paid for each. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Operating Surplus</I>&#148; means, 
with respect to any period ending prior to the Liquidation Date, on a cumulative
basis and
without duplication:<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a)
the sum of: (i)&nbsp;$50.0 million, (ii)&nbsp;all cash receipts of the Company 
Group (or
the Company&#146;s proportionate share of cash receipts in the case of 
Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) for the period beginning on the Closing 
Date and ending on the last day of such period, but excluding cash receipts from
Interim Capital
Transactions and provided that cash receipts from the termination of any Hedge 
Contract prior to its stipulated settlement or termination date shall be 
included in equal quarterly installments over what would have been the remaining
scheduled life
of such Hedge Contract had it not been so terminated, (iii)&nbsp;all cash 
receipts of the Company Group (or the Company&#146;s proportionate share of cash
receipts in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) after the end of
such period
but on or before the date of determination of Operating </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">13 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
Surplus with respect to such period resulting from Working Capital Borrowings, 
(iv)&nbsp;cash and cash equivalents on hand on the date of determination of 
Available Cash resulting from cash
distributions received after the end of such Quarter from any Group 
Member&#146;s equity interest in any Person (other than a Subsidiary), which 
distributions are paid by such Person in respect of operations conducted by such
Person during such
Quarter and not from sources that would constitute Interim Capital Transactions 
if paid by a Group Member and (v)&nbsp;the amount of cash distributions paid in 
respect of Construction Equity to fund Expansion Capital Expenditures (including
incremental Incentive Distributions) and paid in respect of the Construction 
Period, <I>less</I> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) the 
sum of:
(i)&nbsp;Operating Expenditures for the period beginning on the Closing Date and
ending on the last day of such period, (ii)&nbsp;the amount of cash reserves (or
the Company&#146;s proportionate share of cash reserves in the case of 
Subsidiaries
that are not wholly owned) established by the Board of Directors to provide 
funds for future Operating Expenditures, (iii)&nbsp;all Working Capital 
Borrowings not repaid within 12 months after having been incurred or repaid 
within such 12-month
period with the proceeds of additional Working Capital Borrowings, and 
(iv)&nbsp;any cash loss realized on disposition of an Investment Capital 
Expenditure; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><I>provided</I>, <I>however</I>, that disbursements made (including 
contributions to a Group Member or disbursements on behalf of a Group Member), 
cash
received or cash reserves established, increased or reduced after the end of
such period but on or before the date of determination of Available Cash with 
respect to such period shall be deemed to have been made, established, increased
or reduced,
for purposes of determining Operating Surplus, within such period if the Board 
of Directors so determines.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>Notwithstanding
the foregoing, &#147;<I>Operating Surplus</I>&#148; with respect to the Quarter 
in which the Liquidation Date occurs and any subsequent Quarter shall equal 
zero. Cash receipts from Investment Capital Expenditures shall be treated as 
cash receipts
only to the extent they are a return on capital, and not a return of capital.<I>
</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Opinion of 
Counsel</I>&#148; means a
written opinion of counsel (who may be regular counsel to the Company or the 
Transocean Member or any of its Affiliates) acceptable to the Board of 
Directors. <I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Option Closing Date</I>&#148; means
the date or dates on which any Common Units are sold by the Transocean Member to
the
Underwriters upon exercise of the Underwriters&#146; Option.<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Outstanding</I>&#148; means, with 
respect to
Membership Interests, all Membership Interests that are issued by the Company 
and reflected as outstanding on the Company&#146;s books and records as of the 
date of determination.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">&#147;<I>Percentage Interest</I>&#148; means as of 
any date of determination (a)&nbsp;as to any Unitholder with respect to Units, 
the product
obtained by multiplying (i)&nbsp;100% less the percentage applicable to 
clause&nbsp;(b) below by (ii)&nbsp;the quotient obtained by dividing 
(A)&nbsp;the number of Units held by such Unitholder, by (B)&nbsp;the total 
number of all Outstanding Units,
and (b)&nbsp;as to the holders of other Membership Interests issued by the 
Company in accordance with Section 5.4, the percentage established as a part of 
such issuance. The Percentage Interest with respect to an Incentive Distribution
Right and the
Transocean Member Interest shall at all times be zero. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">14 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Person</I>&#148; means an 
individual or a corporation, firm, limited liability
company, partnership, joint venture, trust, unincorporated organization, 
association, governmental agency or political subdivision thereof or other 
entity.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Plan of Conversion</I>&#148; has 
the meaning assigned to such term in Section 14.1.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Pro Rata</I>&#148; means 
(a)&nbsp;when used with respect to Units or any class thereof, apportioned among
all designated Units
in accordance with their relative Percentage Interests, (b)&nbsp;when used with 
respect to Members or Record Holders, apportioned among all Members or Record
Holders in accordance with their relative Percentage Interests, (c)&nbsp;when 
used with
respect to holders of Incentive Distribution Rights, apportioned among all 
holders of Incentive Distribution Rights in accordance with the relative number 
or percentage of Incentive Distribution Rights held by each such holder and 
(d)&nbsp;when used
with respect to holders who have requested to include Registrable Securities in 
a Registration Statement pursuant to Section 7.20(a) or 7.20(b), apportioned 
among all such Holders in accordance with the relative number of Registrable 
Securities held
by each such holder and included in the Notice relating to such request.<I> 
</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Purchase Date</I>&#148; 
means the date
determined by the Transocean Member as the date for purchase of all Outstanding 
Non-Transocean Member Interests of a certain class (other than Non-Transocean 
Member Interests owned by the Transocean Member and its Affiliates) pursuant to 
Article
XV.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Quarter</I>&#148; 
means, unless the context requires otherwise, a fiscal quarter, or, with respect
to the
first fiscal quarter including the Closing Date, the portion of such fiscal 
quarter after the Closing Date, of the Company.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Record Date</I>&#148; means the 
date established by the Board of Directors or otherwise in accordance with this 
Agreement for
determining (a)&nbsp;the identity of the Record Holders entitled to notice of, 
or to vote at, any meeting of Non-Transocean Members or entitled to vote by 
ballot or give approval of Company action in writing without a meeting or 
entitled to exercise
rights in respect of any lawful action of Non-Transocean Members or (b)&nbsp;the
identity of Record Holders entitled to receive any report or distribution or to 
participate in any offer.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Record Holder</I>&#148; means 
(a)&nbsp;with respect to Membership Interests of any class of Membership 
Interests for which a
Transfer Agent has been appointed,&nbsp;the Person in whose name a Membership 
Interest of such class is registered on the books of the Transfer Agent as of 
the closing of business on a particular Business Day, or (b)&nbsp;with respect 
to other
classes of Membership Interests, the Person in whose name any such other 
Membership Interest is registered on the books that the Board of Directors has 
caused to be kept as of the closing of business on such Business Day (which 
books may be kept, at
the Board of Directors&#146; option, by the Transfer Agent).<I> </I></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Register</I>&#148; has the meaning 
assigned to such
term in Section 4.5(a).<I> </I></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">15 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Registrable Security</I>&#148; 
means any Membership Interest other than the
Transocean Member Interest; <I>provided, however</I>, that any Registrable 
Security shall cease to be a Registrable Security (a)&nbsp;at the time a
Registration Statement covering such Registrable Security is declared effective 
by the Commission or
otherwise becomes effective under the Securities Act, and such Registrable 
Security has been sold or disposed of pursuant to such Registration Statement; 
(b)&nbsp;at the time such Registrable Security has been disposed of pursuant to 
Rule 144 (or
any successor or similar rule or regulation under the Securities Act); 
(c)&nbsp;when such Registrable Security is held by a Group Member; and 
(d)&nbsp;at the time such Registrable Security has been sold in a private 
transaction in which the
transferor&#146;s rights under Section 7.20 have not been assigned to the 
transferee of such securities.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Registration Statement</I>&#148; 
has the meaning assigned to such term in Section 7.20(a).<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Rig Companies</I>&#148; means, 
collectively, the Holding Companies, the Rig Operating Companies and the Rig 
Owning Companies
and any successors thereto.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Rig Operating Companies</I>&#148; means, collectively, 
Transocean RIGP DIN LLC,
Transocean RIGP DCL LLC, Transocean RIGP DD3 LLC and any successor thereto.<I> 
</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Rig Owning 
Companies</I>&#148; means,
collectively, Triton RIGP DIN Holdco Ltd., Triton RIGP DCL Holdco Ltd., Triton 
RIGP DD3 Holdco Ltd. and any successor thereto.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Second Target 
Distribution</I>&#148; means $0.453125 per Unit per Quarter (or, with respect to
the period commencing on the
Closing Date and ending on September&nbsp;30, 2014, it means the product of 
$0.453125 multiplied by a fraction of which the numerator is equal to the number
of days in such period and of which the denominator is the total number of days 
in the
Quarter in which the Closing Date occurs), subject to adjustment in accordance 
with Section 6.4.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Securities
Act</I>&#148; means the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, supplemented or 
restated from time to time and any successor to such statute.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Selling Unitholder</I>&#148; means 
a Holder who is selling Registrable Securities pursuant to the procedures in 
Section
7.20.<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Special 
Approval</I>&#148; means approval by a majority of the members of the Conflicts 
Committee.<I>
</I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Subordinated 
Unit</I>&#148; means a Membership Interest having the rights and obligations 
specified with respect to
Subordinated Units in this Agreement. The term &#147;Subordinated Unit&#148; 
does not include a Common Unit. A Subordinated Unit that is convertible into a 
Common Unit shall not constitute a Common Unit until such conversion occurs.<I> 
</I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I>&#147;<I>Subordination Period</I>&#148; 
means the period commencing on the Closing Date and ending on the first to occur
of the
following dates:<I> </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt;
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a)
the first Business Day following the distribution of Available Cash from 
Operating Surplus to
Members pursuant to Section 6.1(a) in respect of any Quarter ending on or after 
June&nbsp;30, 2019, in respect of which (i)(A) aggregate distributions of </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">16 </P>
