<SMALL>RELATED</SMALL>
<SMALL>EQUIPMENT</SMALL>, <SMALL>EXCEPT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>EXTENT</SMALL> <SMALL>CAUSED</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL>
P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>S</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROSS</SMALL>
N<SMALL>EGLIGENCE</SMALL>,
W<SMALL>ILLFUL</SMALL> M<SMALL>ISCONDUCT</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>FRAUD</SMALL>. E<SMALL>XCEPT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL>
<SMALL>EXTENT</SMALL> <SMALL>EXPRESSLY</SMALL> <SMALL>PROVIDED</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IN</SMALL>
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>IMMEDIATELY</SMALL> <SMALL>PRECEDING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SENTENCE</SMALL>, <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> <SMALL>INDEMNIFICATION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IS</SMALL> <SMALL>EXPRESSLY</SMALL> <SMALL>INTENDED</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL>
<SMALL>APPLY</SMALL> R<SMALL>EGARDLESS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
C<SMALL>AUSE</SMALL>. T<SMALL>HIS</SMALL> <SMALL>INDEMNIFICATION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SHALL</SMALL> <SMALL>SURVIVE</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CONTINUE</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL>
<SMALL>FULL</SMALL> <SMALL>FORCE</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EFFECT</SMALL> <SMALL>NOTWITHSTANDING</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EXPIRATION</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>TERMINATION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL>
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>REASON</SMALL> <SMALL>WHATSOEVER</SMALL>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>5.2.2
</B>F<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>AVOIDANCE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>DOUBT</SMALL>, <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EVENT</SMALL> <SMALL>THAT</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>MEMBER</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL>
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THAT</SMALL> <SMALL>IS</SMALL> <SMALL>JOINTLY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OWNED</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
T<SMALL>RANSOCEAN</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL>
(<SMALL>OTHER</SMALL> <SMALL>THAN</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL>) <SMALL>IS</SMALL> <SMALL>UNABLE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>FULFILL</SMALL> <SMALL>ITS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SEVERAL</SMALL> <SMALL>INDEMNITY</SMALL>
<SMALL>OBLIGATION</SMALL> <SMALL>UNDER</SMALL> 
<U>S<SMALL>ECTION</SMALL>&nbsp;5.2.1</U> <SMALL>WITH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>RESPECT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
D<SMALL>AMAGES</SMALL> <SMALL>PROPERLY</SMALL> <SMALL>BROUGHT</SMALL>
<SMALL>UNDER</SMALL> <U>S<SMALL>ECTION</SMALL>&nbsp;5.2.1</U>, <SMALL>IN</SMALL>
<SMALL>NO</SMALL> <SMALL>EVENT</SMALL> <SMALL>SHALL</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> <SMALL>HAVE</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>INDEMNITY</SMALL>
<SMALL>OBLIGATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>HEREUNDER</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EXCESS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>S</SMALL> <SMALL>PERCENTAGE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OWNERSHIP</SMALL> <SMALL>INTEREST</SMALL>
<SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> <SMALL>MEMBER</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL> <SMALL>AS</SMALL>
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>TIME</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL>
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>EVENT</SMALL>(<SMALL>S</SMALL>) <SMALL>GIVING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>RISE</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>INDEMNITY</SMALL> <SMALL>OBLIGATION</SMALL>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.3 <U>I<SMALL>NDEMNIFICATION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>BY</SMALL> P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL>.</U></B><U> <B></B></U><B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.3.1 
</B>P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL> <SMALL>SHALL</SMALL> <SMALL>FULLY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>INDEMNIFY</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL>
<SMALL>DEFEND</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> 
G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>ITS</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>FFILIATES</SMALL>, <SMALL>DIRECTORS</SMALL>, <SMALL>OFFICERS</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>EMPLOYEES</SMALL>, <SMALL>AGENTS</SMALL>
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>SUBCONTRACTORS</SMALL> <SMALL>FROM</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>AGAINST</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL>
<SMALL>ALL</SMALL> D<SMALL>AMAGES</SMALL> <SMALL>DIRECTLY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL>
<SMALL>INDIRECTLY</SMALL> <SMALL>RELATED</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>ONLY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>EXTENT</SMALL> <SMALL>CAUSED</SMALL>
<SMALL>BY</SMALL>
P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>S</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROSS</SMALL> 
N<SMALL>EGLIGENCE</SMALL>, W<SMALL>ILLFUL</SMALL> M<SMALL>ISCONDUCT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>FRAUD</SMALL>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.3.2 
</B>N<SMALL>OTWITHSTANDING</SMALL> <SMALL>ANYTHING</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THIS</SMALL>
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CONTRARY</SMALL>, <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>NO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EVENT</SMALL> (R<SMALL>EGARDLESS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CAUSE</SMALL>) <SMALL>SHALL</SMALL>
P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABLE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL>
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>ITS</SMALL> A<SMALL>FFILIATES</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>OFFICERS</SMALL>,
<SMALL>EMPLOYEES</SMALL>, <SMALL>AGENTS</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SUBCONTRACTORS</SMALL> <SMALL>WITH</SMALL> <SMALL>RESPECT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>CLAIMS</SMALL> <SMALL>ARISING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OUT</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL>
<SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>EXTENT</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CLAIMS</SMALL> <SMALL>ARISE</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CONNECTION</SMALL> <SMALL>WITH</SMALL>
S<SMALL>ERVICES</SMALL> <SMALL>RENDERED</SMALL> <SMALL>WITH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>RESPECT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PERFORMANCE</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>A</SMALL> 
N<SMALL>ON</SMALL>-C<SMALL>ONFORMING</SMALL>
D<SMALL>RILLING</SMALL> C<SMALL>ONTRACT</SMALL>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>5.3.3 </B>N<SMALL>OTWITHSTANDING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ANYTHING</SMALL>
<SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL>
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>CONTRARY</SMALL>, <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>NO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EVENT</SMALL> (R<SMALL>EGARDLESS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
C<SMALL>AUSE</SMALL>)
<SMALL>SHALL</SMALL> P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>LIABLE</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ITS</SMALL> A<SMALL>FFILIATES</SMALL>,
<SMALL>OFFICERS</SMALL>, <SMALL>EMPLOYEES</SMALL>, <SMALL>AGENTS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>SUBCONTRACTORS</SMALL> <SMALL>WITH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>RESPECT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>CLAIMS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ARISING</SMALL> <SMALL>OUT</SMALL>
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>AMOUNTS</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AGGREGATE</SMALL> </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">13 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
<SMALL>EXCEEDING</SMALL> 10 <SMALL>TIMES</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AGGREGATE</SMALL> S<SMALL>ERVICES</SMALL> F<SMALL>EE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PAID</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL>
P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL> <SMALL>UNDER</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>ONE</SMALL>
<SMALL>CALENDAR</SMALL> <SMALL>YEAR</SMALL> <SMALL>PERIOD</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PRIOR</SMALL>
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>OCCURRENCE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>GIVING</SMALL> <SMALL>RISE</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DAMAGES</SMALL>; <SMALL>PROVIDED</SMALL>, <SMALL>THAT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IF</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL>
<SMALL>DATE</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OCCURRENCE</SMALL> <SMALL>IS</SMALL> <SMALL>PRIOR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>DATE</SMALL> <SMALL>THAT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IS</SMALL> <SMALL>ONE</SMALL>
<SMALL>CALENDAR</SMALL> <SMALL>YEAR</SMALL> <SMALL>AFTER</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>DATE</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL>, <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> <SMALL>CAP</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SHALL</SMALL>
<SMALL>INSTEAD</SMALL> <SMALL>EQUAL</SMALL> 10 <SMALL>TIMES</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>ANNUALIZED</SMALL> <SMALL>AGGREGATE</SMALL> 
S<SMALL>ERVICES</SMALL> F<SMALL>EE</SMALL> <SMALL>PAID</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL>
P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL>
<SMALL>UNDER</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PRIOR</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>DATE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> <SMALL>OCCURRENCE</SMALL>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.4 <U>Indemnification Procedures</U>.</B> <B> 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.4.1 Third-Party Claim.</B> The
Company Group member&#146;s indemnification obligation pursuant to 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.2</U>
and Provider&#146;s indemnification obligation pursuant to 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.3</U>, in each case, with respect to Damages claimed or 
asserted against a person claiming indemnification under this Agreement (an 
&#147;<B>Indemnified Party</B>&#148;) by
a third party (that third-party claim or assertion, a &#147;<B>Claim</B>&#148;),
are subject to the following terms and conditions:<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B></B>(a) The Indemnified Party 
shall, with reasonable promptness after the Indemnified Party has notice of a 
Claim,
(1)&nbsp;notify the Party from whom indemnification is sought (the 
&#147;<B>Indemnifying Party</B>&#148;) of the existence of that Claim and 
(B)&nbsp;transmit to the Indemnifying Party a notice (a &#147;<B>Claim 
Notice</B>&#148;) describing, in
reasonable detail, the nature of the Claim, and copies of any papers served with
respect to such Claim. Within 30 calendar days after receipt of any Claim Notice
(the &#147;<B>Election Period</B>&#148;), the Indemnifying Party shall notify 
the
Indemnified Party (A)&nbsp;whether the Indemnifying Party disputes its potential
liability to the Indemnified Party under this <U>Article 5</U> with respect to 
such Claim and (B)&nbsp;whether the Indemnifying Party desires, at its sole cost
and
expense, to defend the Indemnified Party against such Claim. If the Indemnifying
Party does not notify the Indemnified Party within the Election Period that the 
Indemnifying Party disputes its potential liability with respect to such Claim, 
any
Damages resulting from such Claim shall be payable by the Indemnifying Party 
under this Agreement. The Indemnified Party is hereby authorized, at the sole 
cost and expense of the Indemnifying Party (but only if the Indemnified Party is
entitled to
indemnification under this Agreement), to file, during the Election Period, any 
motion, answer or other pleadings that the Indemnified Party shall reasonably 
deem necessary or appropriate to protect its interests or those of the 
Indemnifying
Party.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) If the 
Indemnifying Party notifies the Indemnified Party within the Election Period 
that the
Indemnifying Party elects to assume the defense of the Claim, then this 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(b)</U> shall apply (but not otherwise) and the 
Indemnifying Party shall have the right to defend, at its sole cost and expense 
(if the Indemnified Party is
entitled to indemnification under this Agreement), such Claim by all appropriate
proceedings, which proceedings shall be prosecuted diligently by the 
Indemnifying Party to a final conclusion or settled at the discretion of the 
Indemnifying Party in
accordance with this <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(b)</U>. The Indemnified Party may, at
its own cost and expense, participate in, but not control, any defense or 
settlement of any Claim controlled by the Indemnifying
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">14 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
Party pursuant to this <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(b)</U>. Notwithstanding anything in
this <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(b)</U> to the contrary, the Indemnifying Party may 
not, without the express written
consent of the Indemnified Party, agree to any compromise or settlement which 
does not include an unconditional release of the Indemnified Party from all 
Damages. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) If the Indemnifying Party fails
to notify the Indemnified Party within the Election Period that the Indemnifying
Party
elects to assume the defense of the Claim or if the Indemnifying Party elects to
assume the defense of the Claim but fails to satisfy its obligations under 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(b)</U>, then this <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(c)</U> shall apply
(but not
otherwise) and the Indemnified Party shall have the right to defend, at the sole
cost and expense of the Indemnifying Party (if the Indemnified Party is entitled
to indemnification under this Agreement), the Claim by all appropriate 
proceedings,
which proceedings shall be prosecuted diligently by the Indemnified Party to a 
final conclusion or settled at the discretion of the Indemnified Party. The 
Indemnified Party shall have full control of such defense and proceedings, 
including any
compromise or settlement of such defense and proceedings, <I>provided</I> that 
the Indemnifying Party shall not be liable for any such compromise or settlement
unless such compromise or settlement is made with the Indemnifying Party&#146;s 
express
written consent (which shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or 
delayed). The Indemnifying Party may, at its own cost and expense, participate 
in, but not control, any defense or settlement of any Claim controlled by the 
Indemnified Party
pursuant to this <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(c)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">(d) Notwithstanding anything in this 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1</U> to the
contrary, to the extent (1)&nbsp;the Indemnifying Party has delivered a notice 
to the Indemnified Party that the Indemnifying Party disputes its potential 
liability to the Indemnified Party under this <U>Article 5</U> and (B)&nbsp;such
dispute is
resolved in favor of the Indemnifying Party, the Indemnifying Party shall not be
required to bear the costs and expenses of the Indemnifying Party&#146;s defense
pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(b)</U> or the Indemnified Party&#146;s defense
pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4.1(c)</U>, and the Indemnified Party shall 
reimburse the Indemnifying Party in full for all of those costs and expenses. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.4.2 No Third-Party Claim.</B> 
In the event any Indemnified Party claims indemnification against any 
Indemnifying Party
under this Agreement but that claim for indemnification does not involve a 
Claim, the Indemnified Party shall (A)&nbsp;notify the Indemnifying Party and 
(B)&nbsp;transmit to the Indemnifying Party a notice (an &#147;<B>Indemnity 
Notice</B>&#148;)
describing, in reasonable detail, the nature of the claim. Within 30 calendar 
days after receipt of any Indemnity Notice, the Indemnifying Party shall notify 
the Indemnified Party whether the Indemnifying Party disputes its potential 
liability to
the Indemnified Party under this <U>Article 5</U>. If the Indemnifying Party 
does not notify the Indemnified Party within such 30-day period that the 
Indemnifying Party disputes its potential liability with respect to such 
Indemnity Notice, any
Damages resulting from such Indemnity Notice shall be payable by the 
Indemnifying Party under this Agreement. The provisions of this 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4</U> are in all cases subject to the limitations set forth in
Sections <U>5.2</U>, <U>5.3</U> and
<U>5.5</U> and elsewhere in this Agreement. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">15 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.5 <U>L<SMALL>IMITATION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ON</SMALL>
D<SMALL>AMAGES</SMALL></U><SMALL></SMALL>.</B> N<SMALL>OTWITHSTANDING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ANYTHING</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CONTRARY</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL>, I<SMALL>N</SMALL>
<SMALL>NO</SMALL> <SMALL>EVENT</SMALL> <SMALL>SHALL</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL>, <SMALL>ITS</SMALL> <SMALL>RESPECTIVE</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>FFILIATES</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>THEIR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>RESPECTIVE</SMALL>
<SMALL>DIRECTORS</SMALL>, <SMALL>OFFICERS</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EMPLOYEES</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABLE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>UNDER</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL>
C<SMALL>ONSEQUENTIAL</SMALL> D<SMALL>AMAGES</SMALL>, <SMALL>HOWEVER</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CAUSED</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>ON</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THEORY</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABILITY</SMALL> 
(<SMALL>INCLUDING</SMALL>
<SMALL>NEGLIGENCE</SMALL>) <SMALL>ARISING</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>WAY</SMALL> <SMALL>OUT</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>PROVISION</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THIS</SMALL>
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL>, <SMALL>WHETHER</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>NOT</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL> <SMALL>HAS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>BEEN</SMALL> <SMALL>ADVISED</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL>
<SMALL>POSSIBILITY</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DAMAGES</SMALL>; <SMALL>PROVIDED</SMALL>, <SMALL>HOWEVER</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>THAT</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>FOREGOING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>LIMITATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>SHALL</SMALL>
<SMALL>NOT</SMALL> <SMALL>LIMIT</SMALL> <SMALL>EACH</SMALL>
P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>S</SMALL> <SMALL>INDEMNIFICATION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OBLIGATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABILITIES</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THIRD</SMALL>
<SMALL>PARTIES</SMALL> <SMALL>AS</SMALL> <SMALL>SET</SMALL> <SMALL>FORTH</SMALL>
<SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> <U>A<SMALL>RTICLE</SMALL> 5</U>. 
F<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>PURPOSES</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL>
<U>A<SMALL>RTICLE</SMALL> 5</U>, &#147;<B>C<SMALL>ONSEQUENTIAL</SMALL> 
D<SMALL>AMAGES</SMALL></B><SMALL></SMALL>&#148; <SMALL>MEAN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>EXEMPLARY</SMALL>, <SMALL>PUNITIVE</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>SPECIAL</SMALL>,
<SMALL>INDIRECT</SMALL>, <SMALL>CONSEQUENTIAL</SMALL>, <SMALL>REMOTE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>SPECULATIVE</SMALL> <SMALL>DAMAGES</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>IT</SMALL> <SMALL>BEING</SMALL> <SMALL>UNDERSTOOD</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THAT</SMALL>
<SMALL>LOST</SMALL> <SMALL>PROFITS</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>REVENUES</SMALL> (<SMALL>WHETHER</SMALL> <SMALL>DIRECT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>INDIRECT</SMALL>), <SMALL>FAILURE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>MEET</SMALL>
<SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>DISTRIBUTION</SMALL> <SMALL>EXPECTATIONS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>DAMAGES</SMALL> <SMALL>ASSOCIATED</SMALL> 
<SMALL>WITH</SMALL> <SMALL>LOSS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>USE</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>DELAY</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>BUSINESS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>INTERRUPTION</SMALL> <SMALL>SHALL</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DEEMED</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SPECULATIVE</SMALL>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.6 <U>L<SMALL>IMITED</SMALL> 
R<SMALL>ECOURSE</SMALL></U><SMALL></SMALL>.</B> E<SMALL>XCEPT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AS</SMALL>
<SMALL>EXPRESSLY</SMALL> <SMALL>PROVIDED</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL>, (1)&nbsp;<SMALL>NO</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>FFILIATE</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL> <SMALL>WILL</SMALL>
<SMALL>HAVE</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABILITY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>RESPONSIBILITY</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>RELATING</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CONNECTION</SMALL>
<SMALL>WITH</SMALL> <SMALL>A</SMALL> P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>S</SMALL> 
<SMALL>BREACHES</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>REPRESENTATION</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>FAILURE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TO</SMALL>
<SMALL>PERFORM</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>TERM</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>COVENANT</SMALL>, <SMALL>CONDITION</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PROVISION</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL>
(2)&nbsp;<SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>PURSUING</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>REMEDY</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL>&#146;<SMALL>S</SMALL> <SMALL>BREACH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL>
<SMALL>TERM</SMALL>, <SMALL>COVENANT</SMALL>, <SMALL>CONDITION</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>PROVISION</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL>
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DUTY</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>STANDARD</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CONDUCT</SMALL> <SMALL>BASED</SMALL> <SMALL>ON</SMALL> 
<SMALL>NEGLIGENCE</SMALL>, G<SMALL>ROSS</SMALL> N<SMALL>EGLIGENCE</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>STRICT</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABILITY</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>PERSONAL</SMALL> <SMALL>INJURY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>OTHER</SMALL> <SMALL>TORT</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>VIOLATION</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>APPLICABLE</SMALL> 
G<SMALL>OVERNMENTAL</SMALL>
R<SMALL>EQUIREMENTS</SMALL>, <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>OTHERWISE</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>NO</SMALL> P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL> <SMALL>WILL</SMALL> <SMALL>HAVE</SMALL>
<SMALL>RECOURSE</SMALL> <SMALL>AGAINST</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
P<SMALL>ERSON</SMALL>
<SMALL>OTHER</SMALL> <SMALL>THAN</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DEFAULTING</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>BREACHING</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PARTY</SMALL> <SMALL>ITSELF</SMALL> <SMALL>NOR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AGAINST</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL>
<SMALL>ASSETS</SMALL> <SMALL>OTHER</SMALL> <SMALL>THAN</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>ASSETS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DEFAULTING</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>BREACHING</SMALL> 
P<SMALL>ARTY</SMALL>
<SMALL>ITSELF</SMALL>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.7 
<U>E<SMALL>XPRESS</SMALL> N<SMALL>EGLIGENCE</SMALL></U><SMALL></SMALL>.</B> 
E<SMALL>XCEPT</SMALL>
<SMALL>AS</SMALL> <SMALL>OTHERWISE</SMALL> <SMALL>EXPRESSED</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THEREIN</SMALL>, <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>INDEMNITY</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>RELEASES</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>LIMITATIONS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>ON</SMALL> <SMALL>DAMAGES</SMALL>,
<SMALL>RECOURSE</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABILITIES</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> 
(<SMALL>INCLUDING</SMALL> <U>A<SMALL>RTICLE</SMALL> 5</U>) <SMALL>ARE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>INTENDED</SMALL>
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> <SMALL>ENFORCEABLE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AGAINST</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> P<SMALL>ARTIES</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>ACCORDANCE</SMALL> <SMALL>WITH</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>EXPRESS</SMALL>
<SMALL>TERMS</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>SCOPE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THEREOF</SMALL>, <SMALL>REGARDLESS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CAUSE</SMALL>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 6 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>CONFIDENTIALITY </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>6.1
</B>All Company Confidential Information furnished to, or developed by, any 
member of the Transocean Group or any of its respective employees, directors or 
sub-contractors pursuant to this Agreement shall be kept confidential by 
Provider, subject to
the provisions below, during and for a period of two years after the term of 
this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>6.1.1 
</B>For the purpose
of this <U>Section&nbsp;6.1</U>, &#147;<B>Company Confidential 
Information</B>&#148; shall mean information relating to the business of the 
Company Group, as well as all know-how, trade secrets and other intellectual 
property rights of the Company
Group of which Provider becomes aware or generates in the course of or in 
connection with the performance of its obligations hereunder.<B> </B></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">16 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>6.1.2 </B>The provisions of this
<U>Section&nbsp;6.1</U> shall not apply to
Company Confidential Information which: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">(a) is required to be disclosed by law or court order; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) is public knowledge at the time
of the Effective Date; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) has become public knowledge 
other than as a result of the conduct of Provider prohibited hereunder; or </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) has been approved in writing 
for disclosure by the disclosure committee of the Transocean Group or the 
disclosure committee
of the Company Group. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>6.2 </B>All 
Transocean Confidential Information furnished to, or developed by, any member of
the Company Group
or any of its respective employees, directors or sub-contractors pursuant to 
this Agreement shall be the property of Provider and shall be kept confidential 
by the Company Group, subject to the provisions below, during and for a period 
of two years
after the term of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>6.2.1 </B>For the purpose of this <U>Section&nbsp;6.2</U>, 
&#147;<B>Transocean
Confidential Information</B>&#148; shall mean information relating to the 
business of the Transocean Group, as well as all know-how, trade secrets and 
other intellectual property rights of the Transocean Group of which the Company 
becomes aware or
generates in the course of or in connection with the performance of its 
obligations hereunder.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>6.2.2 </B>The
provisions of this <U>Section&nbsp;6.2</U> shall not apply to Transocean 
Confidential Information which: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">(a) is required
to be disclosed by law or court order; </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">(b) is public knowledge at the time of the Effective Date; or </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) has become public knowledge 
other than as a result of the conduct of any member of the Company Group 
prohibited hereunder.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>6.3 </B>In the event any patent, 
potential patent or registrable right in any country in the world is developed 
during the execution
of the obligations under this Agreement, the rights to such shall vest solely 
with Provider, and Provider shall be entitled to disclose and use such 
information at its discretion. <B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 7 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DISCONTINUATION OF SERVICES; TERM AND TERMINATION 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>7.1 <U>Discontinuation of Services</U>.</B> The 
Company may, upon 90 days&#146; advance written notice to Provider, elect to 
discontinue
any individual Service from time to time; <U>provided</U>, that in no event 
shall the Company be permitted to terminate the compliance services set forth in
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">17 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
<U>Section&nbsp;2.1.8</U> related to the Consent Decree or the EPA Agreement; 
<U>provided further</U>, that any discontinuation of any Service will not affect
the amounts payable to Provider
hereunder unless (and then only to the extent that) the charges for the 
discontinued Services are separately identified in this Agreement or are charged
based on actual use. The Company shall be liable to Provider for all costs and 
expenses Provider
or any member of the Company Group remains obligated to pay in connection with 
any discontinued Service or Services, except as provided in 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.1.1</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>7.2 <U>Term and Termination</U>.</B> <B> 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>7.2.1</B> This Agreement shall 
have an initial term of five years unless terminated: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) by either Party within 90 days 
of the other Party (i)&nbsp;commencing a voluntary case under the bankruptcy, 
insolvency or
similar law, (ii)&nbsp;making an assignment or any general arrangement for the 
benefit of creditors, (iii)&nbsp;otherwise becoming bankrupt or insolvent 
(however evidenced), (iv)&nbsp;receiving a decree or court order for relief in 
an involuntary
case under the bankruptcy, insolvency or similar law or (v)&nbsp;having 
appointed a liquidator, administrator, receiver, trustee, conservator or similar
official with respect to it or any substantial portion of its property or 
assets; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) by Provider after 90 days&#146;
written notice of: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:10%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) (1) a member of the Transocean 
Group ceasing, directly or indirectly, to have direct or indirect beneficial 
ownership and
the power to vote or direct the voting of at least 25% of the Common Units (as 
defined in the LLC Agreement) or (2)&nbsp;the sale of all or substantially all 
of the assets of the Company; or </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:10%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) the removal of the Transocean 
Member (as defined in the LLC Agreement); or </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) by the Company: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:10%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(i) upon 90 days&#146; written 
notice to Provider for any reason in its sole discretion; or </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:10%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(ii) immediately upon written 
notice to Provider if Provider shall, by any act or omission, be in breach of 
any material
obligation under this Agreement and such breach shall continue for a period of 
90 days after written notice thereof has been delivered by the Company to 
Provider. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>7.2.2 </B>The right of the 
Company to terminate this agreement set forth in <U>Section&nbsp;7.2.1(c)
(ii)</U> and the rights
set forth in <U>Section&nbsp;5.1.1</U> shall constitute the sole and exclusive 
rights and remedies of the Company Group for the failure of Provider to provide 
a Service (or a portion thereof) in accordance herewith or a breach hereof 
(including any
failure or breach caused by an Affiliate of Provider or other third party 
providing a Service hereunder). </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">18 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 8 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>FORCE MAJEURE </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>8.1
<U>Effect and Definition</U>.</B> No failure or omission by any Party to perform
or carry out its obligations in accordance with this Agreement (other than the 
obligation to make payment) shall give rise to any claim by the other Party or 
be deemed
a breach of this Agreement if such failure or omission arises from a Force 
Majeure Event. &#147;<B>Force Majeure Event</B>&#148; shall mean any event or 
circumstance that is beyond the reasonable control of the Party affected 
thereby, including
lightning, earthquakes, tornadoes, hurricanes, floods, wash outs, storms, fires,
explosions, epidemics, acts of God, other natural disasters, acts of the public 
enemy, computer crimes, cyber terrorism, actions by any Governmental Authority 
or other
governmental interference, insurrections, riots, civil disturbance, sabotage, 
terrorism, threats of sabotage or terrorism, vandalism, wars and war like 
actions (whether declared or undeclared and whether actual, pending or 
expected), confiscation,
seizure, arrests or other restraints by a Governmental Authority, blockades, 
embargoes, boycotts, strikes, lockouts, labor unrest and other labor disputes, 
and any shortage of adequate power or transportation facilities.<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>8.2 <U>Notification Requirements</U>.</B> The 
Party claiming to be affected by a Force Majeure Event shall, as soon as 
reasonably
practicable, notify the other Party of the beginning and end of any event 
claimed to be a Force Majeure Event and use commercially reasonable efforts to 
resume performance in accordance with this Agreement as soon as is reasonably 
practicable after
the end of the Force Majeure Event.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>8.3 <U>Cooperation</U>.</B> The Parties shall cooperate in reasonable 
respects with each
other to find alternative means and methods for the provision of any suspended 
Service with respect to a Force Majeure Event.<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 9 </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="center"><B>ADDITION AND
REMOVAL OF PARTIES </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">If Provider consents, 
which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, an Affiliate of the Company 
may become a
Party to this Agreement by executing a joinder in the form attached as 
<U>Exhibit B</U> hereto. If the Company consents, which consent shall not be 
unreasonably withheld, an Affiliate of Provider may become a Party to this 
Agreement by executing a
joinder in the form attached as <U>Exhibit B</U> hereto. Each Party hereto 
hereby agrees that upon execution of a joinder in the form attached as 
<U>Exhibit B</U> hereto and without need for further documents or instruments, 
each such signator shall
become and be a Party under this Agreement, provided that any applicable 
conditions set forth in this <U>Article 9</U> are satisfied. By execution of 
such a joinder, each additional Party represents and warrants that it has all 
requisite authority
to become and be a Party under this Agreement and also agrees to and accepts the
terms and provisions of this Agreement. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">19 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 10 </B></P>

correspondence or notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement
shall be given in English and sent by mail, fax or electronic mail or delivered 
by hand at the following addresses: </P>

</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 11 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>MISCELLANEOUS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>11.1
<U>Construction Rules</U>. </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt;
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>11.1.1 </B>A reference to an Article, Section or Schedule shall mean 
an Article or
Section of, or a Schedule to, this Agreement unless otherwise explicitly set 
forth. The titles and headings herein are for reference purposes only and shall 
not in any manner limit the construction of this Agreement which shall be 
considered as a
whole. <B> </B></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">20 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.1.2</B> The words 
&#147;include,&#148; &#147;includes&#148; and
&#147;including&#148; when used in this Agreement shall be deemed in each case 
to be followed by the words &#147;without limitation.&#148; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.1.3</B> The words 
&#147;hereof,&#148; &#147;herein&#148; and &#147;herewith&#148; and words of 
similar import will,
unless otherwise stated, be construed to refer to this Agreement as a whole and 
not to any particular provision of this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.1.4</B> The word 
&#147;or&#148; when used in this Agreement will not be exclusive. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.1.5</B> Words in the singular
when used in this Agreement will be held to include the plural. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.1.6</B> Unless specifically 
stated otherwise, all dollar amounts referred to in this Agreement or required 
to be paid
pursuant to this Agreement are expressed in and shall be paid in United States 
Dollar funds. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%;
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.2 <U>Binding Effect;
Assignment</U>.</B> This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding 
upon the Parties and their respective legal representatives and successors. 
Neither Party may assign its rights and/or obligations under this Agreement 
without the
consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. 
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.3 <U>Entire Agreement</U>.</B> 
This Agreement and the
Exhibits referenced or attached hereto, together with the Master Services 
Agreement dated August&nbsp;5, 2014 among Transocean Partners Holdings Limited, 
the Company and certain subsidiaries of the Company, constitute the entire 
agreement between
the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and shall supersede all 
prior written and oral and all contemporaneous oral agreements and 
understandings with respect to the subject matter hereof. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.4 <U>Governing Law</U>.</B> This Agreement 
shall be governed and construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the 
State of
Texas (except that the provisions of <U>Article 5</U> shall instead be governed
by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales) without 
regard to principles of conflicts of laws thereof that would result in the 
application of the
laws of any other jurisdiction. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.5
<U>Counterparts</U>.</B> This Agreement, including the Exhibits hereto and the 
other documents
referred to herein, may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be 
deemed to be an original but all of which shall constitute one and the same 
agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.6 <U>No Third Party Beneficiaries</U>.</B> 
This Agreement is solely for the benefit of the Company Group, Provider and any 
Affiliate of
Provider providing Services hereunder and is not intended to confer upon any 
other Person, except for any Indemnified Party under <U>Article 5</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.7 <U>Severability</U>.</B> If any term or 
other provision of this Agreement or the Exhibits attached hereto is determined 
by a
nonappealable decision by a court, administrative agency or arbitrator to be 
invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced by any rule of law or public 
policy, all other conditions and provisions of this Agreement shall nevertheless
remain in full
force and effect so long as the economic or legal substance of the transactions 
contemplated hereby is not </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">21 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
affected in any manner materially adverse to either Party. Upon such 
determination that any term or other provision is invalid, illegal or incapable 
of being enforced, the court, administrative
agency or arbitrator shall interpret this Agreement so as to effect the original
intent of the Parties as closely as possible in an acceptable manner to the end 
that transactions contemplated hereby are fulfilled to the fullest extent 
possible. If
any sentence in this Agreement is so broad as to be unenforceable, the provision
shall be interpreted to be only so broad as is enforceable. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.8 <U>Failure or Indulgence Not Waiver; 
Remedies Cumulative</U>.</B> No failure or delay on the part of any Party in the
exercise of any
right hereunder shall impair such right or be construed to be a waiver of, or 
acquiescence in, any breach of any representation, warranty or agreement herein,
nor shall any single or partial exercise of any such right preclude other or 
further
exercise thereof or of any other right. All rights and remedies existing under 
this Agreement or the Exhibits attached hereto are cumulative to, and not 
exclusive of, any rights or remedies otherwise available. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.9 <U>Amendment</U>.</B> No change or 
amendment will be made to this Agreement except by an instrument in writing 
signed on behalf of
each of the Parties. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.10 
<U>Authority</U>.</B> Each of the Parties represents to the other that 
(a)&nbsp;it has the corporate or
other requisite power and authority to execute, deliver and perform this
Agreement, (b)&nbsp;the execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement by
it have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate or other actions, 
(c)&nbsp;it has duly
and validly executed and delivered this Agreement, and (d)&nbsp;this Agreement 
is a legal, valid and binding obligation, enforceable against it in accordance 
with their respective terms subject to applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, 
reorganization,
moratorium or other similar laws affecting creditors&#146; rights generally and 
general equity principles. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.11 
<U>Specific
Performance</U>.</B> In the event of any actual or threatened default in, or 
breach of, any of the terms, conditions and provisions of this Agreement, the 
Party or the Parties who are or are to be thereby aggrieved shall have the right
to specific
performance and injunctive or other equitable relief of their rights under this 
Agreement, in addition to any and all other rights and remedies at law or in 
equity, and all such rights and remedies shall be cumulative. The Parties agree 
that the
remedies at law for any breach or threatened breach, including monetary damages,
are inadequate compensation for any loss and that any defense in any action for 
specific performance that a remedy at law would be adequate is waived. Any 
requirements
for the securing or posting of any bond with such remedy are waived. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>11.12 <U>Construction</U>.</B> This Agreement shall 
be construed
as if jointly drafted by the Provider and the Company Group and, except as set 
forth in this <U>Section&nbsp;11.12</U>, no rule of construction or strict 
interpretation shall be applied against any Party. T<SMALL>HE</SMALL> 
P<SMALL>ARTIES</SMALL>
<SMALL>EACH</SMALL> <SMALL>ACKNOWLEDGE</SMALL> <SMALL>THAT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>TERMS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> 
A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>WERE</SMALL> <SMALL>DETERMINED</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IN</SMALL>
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>CONTEXT</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>A</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PARENT</SMALL>-<SMALL>SUBSIDIARY</SMALL> <SMALL>RELATIONSHIP</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>ARE</SMALL> <SMALL>NOT</SMALL> <SMALL>INTENDED</SMALL>
<SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>BE</SMALL> <SMALL>COMPARABLE</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>TERMS</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> 
G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL> <SMALL>COULD</SMALL> <SMALL>HAVE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OBTAINED</SMALL> <SMALL>FROM</SMALL>
<SMALL>AN</SMALL> <SMALL>UNAFFILIATED</SMALL> <SMALL>THIRD</SMALL> 
<SMALL>PARTY</SMALL>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.13 <U>Relationship
of Parties</U>.</B>
Each member of the Company Group understands and agrees that Provider&#146;s 
relationship to such member of the Company Group under this Agreement is 
strictly a contractual arrangement on the terms and conditions set forth in this
Agreement, that
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">22 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">
no fiduciary, trust, partnership, joint venture, agency or advisory relationship
exists between Provider and such member of the Company Group, that all Services 
are provided by Provider as an
independent contractor and that such member of the Company Group hereby waives
any and all rights that it may otherwise have under applicable Governmental 
Requirements to make any claims or take any action against Provider or any of 
its Affiliates
based on any theory of agency, fiduciary duty, relationship of trust or other 
special standard of care. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.14 <U>Further
Assurances</U>.</B> From time to time, each Party agrees to execute and deliver 
such additional documents, and will provide such additional information and 
assistance as either Party may reasonably require to carry out the terms of this
Agreement.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>11.15 <U>Survival</U>.</B> The 
Parties agree that <U>Articles 4</U>, <U>5</U>, <U>6</U>, <U>11</U> and 
<U>12</U> and any limitations
on liability or responsibility and any exculpatory, disclaimer, waiver or 
similar provisions will survive the termination of this Agreement and that any 
such termination shall not affect any obligation for the payment of Services 
rendered or any
other amounts due to Provider under this Agreement prior to termination. </P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>11.16 <U>Forum for Disputes</U>.</B> Any actions, 
suits or
proceedings arising out of or relating to this Agreement must be instituted in a
state or federal court located in the State of Texas (assuming such court has 
jurisdiction). The Parties waive any objections they may have to such venue and
irrevocably submit to the jurisdiction of any such court in any such action, 
suit or proceeding. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 12 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>DEFINED TERMS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>12.1
<U>Defined Terms</U>.</B> The following terms shall have the meaning ascribed 
thereto for purposes of this Agreement: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.1</B> 
&#147;<B>Administrative Services</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in 
<U>Section 1.1</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I></I><B>12.1.2 
</B><I></I>&#147;<I></I><B>Affiliate</B><I></I>&#148; means, with respect to any
Person, any other Person
directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under common control with, 
such Person; <I>provided, however</I>, that the Company and its subsidiaries 
shall not be deemed to be Affiliates of Transocean Ltd. and its subsidiaries 
(other than the
Company and its subsidiaries) and that Transocean Ltd. and its subsidiaries 
(other than the Company and its subsidiaries) shall not be deemed to be 
Affiliates of the Company and its subsidiaries. For purposes of this definition,
&#147;control&#148;
(including, with correlative meanings, the terms &#147;controlled by&#148; and 
&#147;under common control with&#148;), as used with respect to any Person, 
means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause 
the direction of
the management or policies of such Person, whether through the ownership of 
voting securities, by contract or otherwise.<I> </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.3</B> 
&#147;<B>Agreement</B>&#148; is defined in the introduction to this Agreement.

font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.24 
</B>&#147;<B>Governmental Authority</B>&#148; means any instrumentality, 
subdivision, court, administrative or other
agency, commission, official or other authority of any country or any state, 
province, prefect, municipality, locality or other government or political 
subdivision thereof, or any governmental, quasi-governmental or private body 
exercising any
executive, regulatory, taxing, importing or other governmental or quasi-
governmental authority.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt;
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>12.1.25
</B>&#147;<B>Governmental Requirement</B>&#148; means at any time (i)&nbsp;any 
law, statute, code, ordinance, order, rule, regulation, judgment, decree, 
injunction, writ, edict, award, authorization or other requirement of any 
Governmental Authority
in effect at that time or (ii)&nbsp;any obligation included in any certificate, 
certification, franchise, permit or license issued by any Governmental Authority
or resulting from binding arbitration, including any requirement under common 
law.<B>
</B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.26 
</B>&#147;<B>Gross Negligence</B>&#148; means a negligent act or negligent 
failure to act (whether sole,
joint or concurrent) by any person, which act or failure to act is more 
fundamental than a failure to exercise proper skill and/or care and would 
reasonably be perceived as entailing an extreme degree of risk of injury to a 
Person or physical loss
of or damage to property (considering the probability and magnitude of the 
potential injury, loss or damage), coupled with the person&#146;s actual 
awareness of and indifference to such extreme risk.<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.27 </B>&#147;<B>Indemnified

<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.33</B> &#147;<B>Non-
Conforming Drilling Contract</B>&#148; means any drilling contract for which 
Provider has notified
the Company Group, prior to the Company Group&#146;s entry therein, that the 
indemnification provisions contained therein do not conform with the Transocean 
Group&#146;s written contracting principles in effect at the time a member of 
the
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">25 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
Company Group entered into such drilling contract. Provider shall provide the 
Company electronic access to written copies of its contracting principles in 
effect as of the Effective Time and
during the term of this Agreement and shall provide the Company electronic 
access to written copies of any amendments or updates to such contracting 
principles. The Company shall provide to Provider drafts of any drilling 
contracts to be entered
into by any member of the Company Group after the Effective Date prior to 
entering into any such drilling contracts. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.34 
</B>&#147;<B>NYSE</B>&#148; means the New York Stock Exchange. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.35</B> 
&#147;<B>Party</B>&#148; is defined in the introduction to this Agreement. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.36 
</B>&#147;<B>Person</B>&#148; means any individual, partnership, joint venture, 
corporation, limited liability
company, limited liability partnership, trust, unincorporated organization or 
association or a Governmental Authority.<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.37</B> 
&#147;<B>Provider</B>&#148; is defined in the introduction to this Agreement. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.38</B> &#147;<B>Provider 
Indemnified Parties</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 
5.2.1</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.39 </B>&#147;<B>Provider
Systems</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 2.2.4(b)</U>. 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.40 </B>&#147;<B>Regardless 
of Cause</B>&#148; means, whether or not any Damages are asserted to have arisen
by virtue
of tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, breach of contract 
(including breach of condition) or quasi-contract, strict liability, 
misrepresentation, breach of any laws, regulations, rules or orders of any 
Governmental Requirements or
otherwise, on the part of the Party or other Person seeking indemnity (or 
exclusion or limitation of liability). Regardless of Cause means whether or not 
any Damages are asserted to have been caused by or arisen by virtue of Gross 
Negligence on the
part of the Party or other Person seeking indemnity (or exclusion or limitation 
of liability).<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>12.1.41</B>
&#147;<B>Reimbursement Statement</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in 
<U>Section 4.1.2</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>12.1.42</B>
&#147;<B>SEC</B>&#148; means the United States Securities and Exchange 
Commission. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.43 
</B>&#147;<B>Security
Regulations</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 
2.2.4(b)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.44</B>
&#147;<B>Services</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 
1.2</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.45 
</B>&#147;<B>Services
Fee</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 4.1.2</U>. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.46</B> &#147;<B>Technical
Services</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 1.1</U>. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">26 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.47</B> &#147;<B>Third Party
Costs</B>&#148; has the meaning given such
term in <U>Section 4.2</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>12.1.48 </B>&#147;<B>Transfer Pricing Rules</B>&#148; means the 
requirements under
Section&nbsp;482 of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, or 
comparable provisions of state, local or foreign law.<B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.49</B> &#147;<B>Transocean 
Confidential Information</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section
6.2.1</U>.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.50 
</B>&#147;<B>Transocean Group</B>&#148; means Transocean Ltd. and its 
subsidiaries, other than the Company and
its subsidiaries. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.51
</B>&#147;<B>Transocean Software</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in
<U>Section
2.2.4(a)</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.52</B> 
&#147;<B>Transfer Taxes</B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in <U>Section 
4.1.6</U>.
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>12.1.53 
</B>&#147;<B>Willful Misconduct</B>&#148; means any intentional wrongful act or 
intentional wrongful failure to
act (whether sole, joint or concurrent) with actual knowledge that such act (or 
failure to act) is wrongful and with the intention to cause injury to a person, 
physical loss of or damage to property, breach of a contract or quasi-contract 
or breach
of any Government Requirement.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="center">[SIGNATURE PAGE FOLLOWS] </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">27 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this 
Agreement to be effective as of the Effective
Date. </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B><U>EXHIBIT B </U></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>FORM OF JOINDER </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman">This
Joinder Agreement (this &#147;<B><I>Agreement</I></B>&#148;) is made as of the 
date written below by the undersigned (the &#147;<B><I>Joining 
Party</I></B>&#148;) in accordance with that certain Master Services Agreement 
(the &#147;<B><I>Master
Services Agreement</I></B>&#148;) by and among <B>Transocean Offshore Deepwater 
Drilling Inc.</B>, a Delaware corporation (together with its Affiliates and 
subsidiaries set forth on <U>Exhibit A</U> to the Master Services Agreement,
&#147;<B>Provider</B>&#148;), <B>Transocean Partners LLC</B>, a Marshall Islands
limited liability company (the &#147;<B>Company</B>&#148;), the holding company 
subsidiaries of the Company which are signatories to the Master Services 
Agreement (each
a &#147;<B>Company Holding Subsidiary</B>&#148;) and the rig-operating 
subsidiaries of the Company which are signatories to the Master Services 
Agreement (each a &#147;<B>Company Operating Subsidiary</B>&#148;). Capitalized 
terms not defined herein
shall have the meanings given to such terms in the Master Services Agreement. 
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The Joining Party hereby acknowledges, 
agrees and confirms
that, by its execution of this Agreement, the Joining Party shall become a party
to the Master Services Agreement as of the date hereof, and (i)&nbsp;shall have 
all of the rights and obligations thereof as more fully set forth therein as if 
it had
executed the Master Services Agreement directly, and (ii)&nbsp;agrees to be 
bound by the terms, provisions and conditions pertaining thereto, as more fully 
set forth therein, as if it had executed the Master Services Agreement directly.
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has executed 
this Agreement as of the date written below. </P>

New Roman">Date:
