 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">i </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>THIS MASTER SERVICES AGREEMENT </B>(the 
&#147;<B>Agreement</B>&#148;), entered into on August&nbsp;5, 2014 (the 
&#147;<B>Effective
Date</B>&#148;), is made by and among <B>Transocean Partners Holdings 
Limited</B>, a Cayman Islands exempted company (together with its Affiliates and
subsidiaries set forth on <U>Exhibit A</U>, &#147;<B>Provider</B>&#148;), 
<B>Transocean Partners
LLC</B>, a Marshall Islands limited liability company (the 
&#147;<B>Company</B>&#148;), the holding company subsidiaries of the Company 
which are signatories to this Agreement (each a &#147;<B>Company Holding 
Subsidiary</B>&#148;) and the rig-owning
and operating subsidiaries of the Company which are signatories to this 
Agreement (each rig owning company a &#147;<B>Company Rig Owning 
Subsidiary</B>&#148; and each operating company a &#147;<B>Company Operating 
Subsidiary</B>&#148;). The Company
Holding Subsidiaries, the Company Rig Owning Subsidiaries and the Company 
Operating Subsidiaries are collectively referred to as the &#147;<B>Company 
Subsidiaries</B>&#148;, and the Company Subsidiaries and the Company are 
collectively referred to
as the &#147;<B>Company Group</B>&#148;. Provider, the Company and the Company 
Subsidiaries are hereinafter jointly referred to as the 
&#147;<B>Parties</B>&#148; and, individually, as a &#147;<B>Party</B>.&#148; 
Certain capitalized terms, when used
in this Agreement, shall have the meanings set forth or referenced in 
<U>Section&nbsp;12.1</U> of this Agreement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="center"><B>RECITALS: </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS, </B>the Company Group obtains certain
services from its own employees and may from time to time wish to supplement 
those services;
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS, </B>the Company Group wishes
to engage Provider to provide, outside of the United States, certain general 
assistance,
administrative support, advisory, technical, general administrative and non-
executive management services to the Company Group to supplement the services 
provided by the employees of the Company Group; and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>WHEREAS</B>, Provider wishes to provide such 
services on the terms set forth herein. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>AGREEMENT: </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>NOW
THEREFORE</B>, in consideration of the mutual covenants expressed herein, the 
Parties hereby agree as follows: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 1 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>APPOINTMENT AND EFFECTIVE DATE </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>1.1 </B>Each member of the Company Group hereby 
confirms the appointment of Provider to provide, outside the United States, the 
general
assistance and administrative support services specified in this Agreement (the 
&#147;<B>Administrative Services</B>&#148;), the advisory and technical services
with their associated general administrative services specified in this 
Agreement (the
&#147;<B>Technical Services</B>&#148;) and certain non-executive management 
services (the &#147;<B>Management Services</B>&#148; and, together with the 
Administrative Services and the Technical Services, the 
&#147;<B>Services</B>&#148;) to each
member of the Company Group, as necessary, subject to the terms and conditions 
set forth in this Agreement, and Provider hereby accepts such appointment. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">1 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>1.2 </B>Notwithstanding anything to the contrary
contained in this Agreement, in no event
shall Provider provide, or be obligated to provide, U.K.-based services to any 
Company Rig Owning Subsidiary hereunder. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>1.3 
</B>The
Board of Directors of the Company (the &#147;<B>Board</B>&#148;) expressly 
retains all authority granted to it pursuant to the Second Amended and Restated 
Limited Liability Company Agreement of the Company, dated July&nbsp;29, 2014 (as
the same may
be amended, restated, modified or supplemented from time to time, the 
&#147;<B>LLC Agreement</B>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" 
ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 2 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>SERVICES </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>2.1
<U>Administrative Services</U>.</B> To the extent requested by the members of 
the Company Group, Provider shall provide, or shall cause to be provided, the
following Administrative Services to the Company Group, together with such other
similar
services as may be agreed upon by Provider and the Company from time to time: 
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.1 Headquarter 
Support.</B> Advice and
assistance in connection with executive oversight, accounting, finance, tax, 
legal, investor relations, marketing, procurement and similar activities of the 
Company Group, including: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) The compilation and preparation
of all annual and quarterly reports to be filed by the Company Group with the 
SEC and other
regulatory bodies, including the preparation of financial statements. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) Support and assistance with 
forecasting,
budgeting, corporate planning, taxation, internal auditing, accounts payable and
accounting. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) Legal matters, 
including
the formation of new entities, assistance with the negotiation and preparation 
of contracts, assistance with negotiation and compliance with local authorities 
and other governing and regulatory bodies, including the SEC, the NYSE and any 
other stock
exchange on which the securities of the Company may be listed. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) Investor relations and 
communications. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) Computer and network hardware, 
software, network services, satellite communications and other information 
systems. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.2 Company Records. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Assistance with the maintenance
of all original corporate documents of the Company Group, including statutory 
books and
records, if requested. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) 
Establishment and maintenance of archives (whether in electronic or physical 
form) of contracts
and other documents of the Company Group. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">2 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.3 Financing.</B> Assistance 
in matters relevant to the financing of the
Company Group&#146;s activities, including forecasting, budgeting, accounts 
payable and receivable processing, taxation, accounting, the identification of 
sources of potential financing, assistance in negotiation of financing 
arrangements and
coordination of financing with other Transocean Group companies for the benefit 
of the Company Group. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.4 
Human
Resources. </B>Assistance in human resources matters, including hiring and 
recruiting, payroll processing, employee compensation and benefits
administration and employee career development. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.5 Insurance. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Insurance administration for 
the Company Group, to the extent necessary, and for the drilling rigs owned or 
operated by
certain members of the Company Group (the &#147;<B>Company Rigs</B>&#148;) in 
accordance with the general guidelines and policies from time to time in force 
for coverage, insurers and terms for the insurance of drilling rigs, including 
the
administration of risk management functions and the delivery and receipt of 
insurance certificates to third parties, including clients and vendors. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) Advice and assistance to the 
Company Group in filing and managing claims under all insurance policies and/or 
within any
deductibles and self-insured retentions procured for the Company Group and the 
Company Rigs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) Advice and 
assistance to
the Company Group in the procurement of other insurance as may be necessary or 
prudent in order to comply with legal or contractual requirements, or otherwise 
prudently insure the risks of the Company Group. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.6 Safety and Training.</B> Assistance to the
Company Group in handling incidents involving the Company Rigs, safety and 
quality control
and employee training. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.7 Legal 
Services/Disputes.</B> Advice and assistance in legal matters, including 
preparation and oversight
of public company reporting and compliance, general commercial and business 
matters (including intellectual property, contract review, and human resources 
matters), prosecution or defense of any and all legal proceedings by or against 
any member of
the Company Group, on such member&#146;s behalf; <I>provided, however</I>, that 
Provider shall not be obligated to provide legal services with respect to 
matters in which the Company Group is adverse to Provider or any Affiliates of 
Provider. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.8 Compliance Services.</B> Advice and 
assistance in compliance program matters including the development and 
implementation of an
effective compliance program, code of conduct and other policies and guidelines 
and any applicable obligations under the Consent Decree, EPA Agreement and other
governmental agreements. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.1.9 No Management Services. </B>For the 
avoidance of doubt, Administrative Services shall not include any Management 
Services. <B>
</B></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">3 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.2 <U>Technical Services</U>.</B> To the extent
requested by the members of the Company
Group, Provider shall provide, or shall cause to be provided, the following 
Technical Services to the Company Group, together with such other similar
services as may be agreed upon by Provider and the Company from time to time: 
</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.2.1 Operations Services.</B> 
Assistance in the establishment of global operating procedures and standards of 
the Company
Rigs, as well as ongoing evaluation and support, including: </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) minimum operating standard 
procedures, including onshore
emergency contingency procedures, offshore contingency plans, rig move 
procedures and review, station keeping procedures, on station marine activities 
and procedures, drilling and well control activities and procedures; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) operation service standards, 
including monitoring drilling unit compliance with maintenance standards and 
regulations, flag
and coastal state requirements, Classification Society requirements, operational
management plans for each drilling contract, equipment list maintenance 
procedures and drilling unit operational capability procedures; and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) safety management systems 
including procedures, monitoring programs and best-practice sharing. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.2.2 Engineering and Technology
Services.</B> Assistance with engineering and technology services relating to 
equipment
modification, including: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a)
upgrades and major repairs; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) design specifications, 
equipment lists and drawings and technical modification accuracy verifications; 
and </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(c) coordination with the 
Classification Societies, Certifying Authorities and Governmental Authorities 
for approval and
compliance with applicable rules and regulations. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt;
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>2.2.3 Incident Management.</B> Assistance to the 
Company Group in
handling any incidents involving the Company Rigs in the course of operations. 
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-
indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.2.4 Software. 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(a) Except for software licensed 
from third parties that are not Affiliates of Provider, all software used on or 
in connection
with any of the Company Rigs (the &#147;<B>Transocean Software</B>&#148;), is 
proprietary to Provider or its Affiliates and is hereby licensed or sublicensed 
non-exclusively, royalty-free to the Company Group solely for use in connection 
with its
business and only until the earlier of the termination of this Agreement or the 
time at which the Service to which such Transocean Software relates terminates 
or ceases to be provided under this Agreement. The Company Group agrees not to 
use the
licensed or </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">4 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
sublicensed Transocean Software or related documentation (other than in 
connection with operation of the Company Rigs during the term of this Agreement)
or to copy, modify, reverse engineer,
reverse compile, or reverse assemble it. Irrespective of any terms to the 
contrary in this Agreement, any and all such licenses and sublicenses shall 
terminate as of the termination of this Agreement. The Company Group shall, 
during the term of this
Agreement and for two years thereafter, upon Provider&#146;s reasonable request 
and upon reasonable prior notice from Provider, make the Company Rigs (or the 
Company Group&#146;s other places of business) available for inspection by 
Provider or its
designated representatives (at Provider&#146;s sole expense) for the sole 
purpose of confirming the Company Group&#146;s compliance with this 
<U>Section&nbsp;2.2.4(a)</U> and subject to Provider&#146;s obligation to keep 
information confidential
pursuant to <U>Article 6</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b)
As a result of the provision of Services, certain employees of the Company Group
may
receive access to computer, software, communications or information networks or 
systems of Provider or its Affiliates, and any related documentation 
(collectively, &#147;<B>Provider Systems</B>&#148;). The Company Group shall 
access and use only
those Provider Systems for which it has been granted the right to access and 
use. The Company Group&#146;s right to access and use is provided for the 
limited purpose of supporting the Services provided hereunder. Individual access
to such Provider
Systems is strictly limited to those employees of the Company Group approved by 
Provider. With respect to all Provider Systems to which any employee of the 
Company Group has access as a result of the Services being provided, the Company
Group
(i)&nbsp;shall use such Provider Systems internally and for their intended 
purpose only, shall not distribute, publish, transfer, sublicense or in any 
manner make such Provider Systems available to other organizations or persons, 
and shall not act
as a service bureau or consultant in connection with such Provider Systems; 
(ii)&nbsp;shall comply with all of Provider&#146;s system security policies, 
procedures and requirements that have been provided to the Company Group 
(&#147;<B>Security
Regulations</B>&#148;); and (iii)&nbsp;shall not tamper with, compromise or 
circumvent any security or audit measures employed by Provider. The Company 
Group shall use commercially reasonable efforts to allow only those employees 
acting on its
behalf who are specifically authorized to have access to the Provider Systems to
gain such access and to prevent unauthorized access, use, destruction, 
alteration or loss of information contained therein, including notifying its 
employees who might
have access to such Provider Systems of the restrictions set forth in this 
Agreement and of the Security Regulations. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman">(c)
If, at any time, (i)&nbsp;any employee of the Company Group or other Person 
acting on its behalf seeks to circumvent, or circumvents, the Security 
Regulations, (ii)&nbsp;any unauthorized employee of the Company Group or Person 
acting on its behalf
accesses the Provider Systems, or (iii)&nbsp;any employee or representative of 
the Company Group engages in activities that may lead to the unauthorized 
access, use, destruction, alteration or loss of data, information or software of
Provider, the
Company Group shall promptly terminate any such employee&#146;s or Person&#146;s
access to the Provider Systems and immediately notify </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">5 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
Provider. In addition, Provider shall have the right to deny any employee of the
Company Group or other Person acting on the Company Group&#146;s behalf access 
to the Provider Systems in the
event that Provider reasonably believes that such employee has engaged in any of
the activities set forth above in this <U>Section&nbsp;2.2.4(c)</U> or otherwise
poses a security concern. The Company Group shall cooperate with Provider in
investigating any apparent unauthorized access to the Provider Systems. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(d) Without limiting the generality of 
any other
provision hereof, the Company Group shall have responsibility under this 
Agreement for the actions and omissions of both its employees and any other 
Person acting on its behalf. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(e) To the extent the Company Group
no longer requires access to the Provider Systems with respect to specific 
software,
functions, systems or services, the Company Group&#146;s access will be 
terminated. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.2.5 No 
Management Services.</B>
For the avoidance of doubt, Technical Services shall not include any Management 
Services. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.3 <U>Management 
Services</U>.</B> To the
extent requested by the members of the Company Group, Provider shall provide, or
shall cause to be provided, the following Management Services to the Company 
Group, together with such other similar services as may be agreed upon by 
Provider and the
Company from time to time: </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>2.3.1 Treasury Services.</B> Subject to any investment policies and 
guidelines established
by the Company from time to time, assistance for all treasury functions, 
including cash management, making and managing investments, administering bank 
accounts, collecting amounts due from third parties, settling debts and settling
inter-company
accounts. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.3.2 Sale and 
Purchase of Assets.</B> Assistance with the sale and purchase of assets on 
behalf of the
Company Operating Subsidiaries, including the completion and integration of such
sales and purchases. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.3.3
Procurement.</B> Assistance in global procurement, including purchasing 
services, logistics services and system administration. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>2.3.4 Technical Supervision.</B>
Assistance to the Company Operating Subsidiaries with services in relation to 
the technical
and operating management of the Company Rigs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; 
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>2.3.5 Marketing Services.</B> Advice and assistance 
to the Company
Operating Subsidiaries in the marketing of the Company Rigs, including the 
collection of marketing information, market analysis, identification of 
commercial agents and potential customers, negotiation and communication of 
contractual commitments,
administration of contract modifications and disputes, monitoring of customer 
satisfaction, identification of Company Rigs available for contract 
opportunities and preparation of bids. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">6 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 3 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>GENERAL CONDITIONS </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.1 <U>Standard of Conduct</U>. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.1.1 </B>The Services to be 
provided hereunder shall be performed with the same general degree of care as 
when Provider and
its Affiliates performed such services within Provider&#146;s organization 
immediately prior to the Effective Date. It is understood and agreed that the 
employees of Provider and the other members of the Transocean Group performing 
the Services are
not professional providers to third parties of the types of services included in
the Services and that Transocean Group employees performing Services have other 
responsibilities and will not be dedicated full-time to performing Services 
hereunder.
E<SMALL>XCEPT</SMALL> <SMALL>AS</SMALL> <SMALL>EXPRESSLY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SET</SMALL> <SMALL>FORTH</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> 
<U>S<SMALL>ECTION</SMALL>&nbsp;3.1.1</U>, <SMALL>NO</SMALL> 
<SMALL>REPRESENTATIONS</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>WARRANTIES</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL>
<SMALL>KIND</SMALL>, <SMALL>EXPRESSED</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IMPLIED</SMALL> (<SMALL>INCLUDING</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>WARRANTIES</SMALL>
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>NON</SMALL>-<SMALL>INFRINGEMENT</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>MERCHANTABILITY</SMALL>, <SMALL>FITNESS</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>A</SMALL> <SMALL>PARTICULAR</SMALL> <SMALL>PURPOSE</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>SEAWORTHINESS</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>CONFORMITY</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL>
<SMALL>REPRESENTATION</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>DESCRIPTION</SMALL>), 
<SMALL>ARE</SMALL> <SMALL>MADE</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>MEMBER</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THE</SMALL> T<SMALL>RANSOCEAN</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL> 
<SMALL>WITH</SMALL> <SMALL>RESPECT</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
S<SMALL>ERVICES</SMALL>
<SMALL>UNDER</SMALL> <SMALL>THIS</SMALL> A<SMALL>GREEMENT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>AND</SMALL>, <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>FULLEST</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EXTENT</SMALL> <SMALL>PERMITTED</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>APPLICABLE</SMALL>
G<SMALL>OVERNMENTAL</SMALL> R<SMALL>EQUIREMENTS</SMALL>, <SMALL>ALL</SMALL> 
<SMALL>SUCH</SMALL> <SMALL>REPRESENTATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> 
<SMALL>WARRANTIES</SMALL> <SMALL>ARE</SMALL> <SMALL>HEREBY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>WAIVED</SMALL>
<SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>DISCLAIMED</SMALL>, R<SMALL>EGARDLESS</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> C<SMALL>AUSE</SMALL>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman"><B>3.1.2
</B>Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as: </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">(a) an assumption by Provider of any obligation to 
increase the sales
or profits of the Company Group or otherwise to guarantee the success of the 
operations of any member of the Company Group; </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(b) the delegation of any function 
or authority by any member of the Company Group to Provider or its employees, it
being
understood that Provider will provide Administrative Services and Technical 
Services, but all decisions with respect to any member of the Company Group and 
its business shall remain with the respective Board of Directors and authorized 
officers and
agents of such Company Group member; or </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-
bottom:0pt; margin-left:8%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">(c) an assumption by Provider of the authority to assume, create or 
conclude any
obligation, express or implied, including the authority to conclude or enter 
into any contracts, on behalf of any member of the Company Group. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.1.3 </B>Notwithstanding 
anything to the contrary contained herein, Provider shall have no obligation to 
provide Services
hereunder to the extent it conflicts or is inconsistent with 
(i)&nbsp;Governmental Requirements, (ii)&nbsp;Transocean policies, including 
Transocean&#146;s Code of Integrity, (iii)&nbsp;the Consent Decree and 
(iv)&nbsp;the EPA Agreement. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">7 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.2 <U>Service Boundaries and Scope</U>. 
</B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.2.1</B> Provider shall be 
required to provide, or cause to be provided, the Services only to the extent 
the same services
are then being provided to any member of the Transocean Group for similar 
operations in the same jurisdiction, and the Services shall be available only 
for purposes of conducting the business relating to the Company Rigs 
substantially in the manner
it was conducted immediately prior to the Effective Date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.2.2</B> Except as otherwise provided in this 
Agreement, in
providing, or causing to be provided, the Services, Provider shall not be 
obligated to: (i)&nbsp;maintain the employment of any specific employee or hire 
additional employees or third-party service providers; (ii)&nbsp;purchase, lease
or license any
additional equipment (including computer equipment, furniture, furnishings, 
fixtures, machinery, vehicles, tools and other tangible personal property), 
software or other assets, rights or properties; (iii)&nbsp;make modifications to
its existing
systems or software; (iv)&nbsp;provide any member of the Company Group with 
access to any specific systems or software; (v)&nbsp;provide or cause to be 
provided any training, licensing or similar services to any officer, employee or
representative
of the Company Group; (vi)&nbsp;provide any marketing, promotional, bid inquiry 
or similar services; (vii)&nbsp;provide any transportation or shipping services;
or (viii)&nbsp;pay any costs related to the transfer or conversion of data of
any member
of the Company Group. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>3.2.3</B> The Company and each Company Subsidiary acknowledges that 
the employees of Provider or
any other members of the Transocean Group who may be assisting in the providing 
of Services hereunder are or may be at-will employees and, in any event, may 
terminate or be terminated from employment with Provider or any of the other 
members of the
Transocean Group providing services hereunder at any time for any reason. </P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.2.4</B> For the avoidance of 
doubt, except
as consented to by Provider in writing, the Services do not include (i)&nbsp;any
services required for or as the result of any business acquisitions from third 
parties, divestitures or start-ups by the Company or any other member of the 
Company
Group or any similar transactions or (ii)&nbsp;any services with respect to any 
Company Rig acquired by any member of the Company Group from any Person that is 
not a member of the Transocean Group. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.3 <U>Third Party Services</U>. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.3.1 </B>Provider shall have 
the right, whenever it deems necessary or advisable, (i)&nbsp;to hire third-
party
subcontractors within the Transocean Group or otherwise used by members of the 
Transocean Group and/or other reputable companies, provided, that Provider shall
reasonably believe that such reputable companies are sufficiently qualified to 
fulfill
the Provider&#146;s duties and obligations hereunder, and (ii)&nbsp;to acquire 
rights from third parties to provide all or part of the Services hereunder. 
Provider will provide to the Company all reasonably requested information 
regarding such
third-party subcontractors. The cost of such additional third-party Services or 
acquisition of such rights shall be billed to and paid for by the applicable 
Company Group member in the manner set forth in <U>Article 4</U>. </P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">8 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.3.2</B> Each member of the 
Company Group hereby acknowledges and agrees that
neither Provider nor any of its Affiliates shall have any responsibility or 
liability for the non-performance, inadequate performance, faulty performance or
other failure or breach by a third-party provider, and, without limiting the 
generality of
the foregoing, neither the Provider nor any of its Affiliates shall be 
responsible, liable or deemed in breach of this Agreement for any delay or 
failure in the performance of its obligations under or in connection with this 
Agreement to the extent
such delay or failure is due to the non-performance, inadequate performance, 
faulty performance or other failure or breach by a third-party provider, 
R<SMALL>EGARDLESS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> C<SMALL>AUSE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>EXCEPT</SMALL>
<SMALL>ONLY</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>EXTENT</SMALL> 
<SMALL>CAUSED</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROSS</SMALL> 
N<SMALL>EGLIGENCE</SMALL>, W<SMALL>ILLFUL</SMALL> M<SMALL>ISCONDUCT</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>FRAUD</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> P<SMALL>ROVIDER</SMALL>
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>ITS</SMALL> A<SMALL>FFILIATES</SMALL>. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.4 <U>Independent Contractor</U>. </B>At all 
times during the performance of the Services, all Persons performing such 
Services (including
agents, temporary employees, independent third parties and consultants) shall be
construed as being independent from the Company and its Affiliates, and no such 
Person shall be considered or deemed to be an employee of any member of the 
Company
Group nor entitled to any employee benefits of the Company Group as a result of 
this Agreement. Except as may be expressly set forth herein as a Service 
(including any additional Services as Provider and the Company may from time to 
time agree),
none of Provider or its Affiliates shall be obligated to provide, or cause to be
provided, any service or goods to the Company or its Affiliates. <B> </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.5 <U>Non-Exclusivity</U>.</B> Provider shall 
be entitled to provide management and other services to other companies in the 
Transocean
Group or third party entities. No preference shall be given to any drilling rig 
or company under Provider&#146;s management but Provider shall, so far as 
commercially reasonable, ensure a fair distribution of service to all such 
drilling rigs and
companies under its management from time to time. </P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman">Provider shall, in the performance of its services, be entitled to 
take into
consideration its overall responsibility in relation to all matters as may from 
time to time be entrusted to its management and in particular, but without 
prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, be entitled to allocate available 
supplies,
manpower and services between its management assignments in such manner as in 
the prevailing circumstances Provider in good faith considers to be fair and 
reasonable. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>3.6 <U>Audit and Maintenance of Records; 
Reporting</U>.</B> Notwithstanding the payment by any member of the Company 
Group of any Costs and
Expenses (as defined below) or Services Fees (as defined below), the Company 
shall have the right to review and contest the charges. For a period of one year
from its receipt of any invoice under <U>Article 4</U>, the Company shall have 
the right,
upon reasonable notice, at reasonable times and at the Company&#146;s sole 
expense, to inspect, review and audit all the records, books, reports, data and 
processes related to the Services performed by Provider to ensure 
Provider&#146;s compliance
with the terms of this Agreement. If any such information is confidential, the 
Parties shall execute a mutually acceptable confidentiality agreement prior to 
such inspection or audit. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">9 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 4 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>PAYMENT TO PROVIDER </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1 <U>Intercompany Costs</U>. </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1.1 </B>Each calendar month,
each applicable Company Group member agrees to reimburse Provider or its 
designee for the
cost of all direct labor, materials and expenses resulting from the provision of
Services hereunder, plus an allocated portion of Provider&#146;s shared and 
pooled direct costs, indirect costs and general and administrative costs 
(including costs
relating to Provider&#146;s development and reserve labor pools for the 
geographic areas in which the Company Rigs are operating), in each case as 
determined by Provider&#146;s internal accounting procedures (the &#147;<B>Costs
and
Expenses</B>&#148;). </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-
left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1.2 
</B>In addition to the reimbursement provided in <U>Section&nbsp;4.1.1</U>, the 
applicable
Company Group member agrees to pay to Provider or its designee a fee equal to 
the greater of (i)&nbsp;5% of such Costs and Expenses or, in the case of the 
provision of capital spares or inventory, a 4% mark-up on the capital spares or 
inventory plus
a 4% mark-up on the allocable share of the costs of providing such services and 
(ii)&nbsp;the mark-up required by applicable Transfer Pricing Rules (as 
determined in Provider&#146;s reasonable discretion) (the &#147;<B>Services 
Fee</B>&#148;). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1.3 </B>Promptly after the 
allocation of the Costs and Expenses for each reimbursement period as set forth 
in
<U>Section&nbsp;4.1.1</U>, the applicable Transocean Group member shall prepare 
a statement of Costs and Expenses incurred in providing the Services, setting 
forth the basis for calculation in such detail as reasonably required. The 
applicable
Transocean Group member shall then deliver an invoice to the applicable Company 
Group member for such costs together with the corresponding Services Fee (an 
&#147;<B>Invoice</B>&#148;). </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1.4 </B>Within 30 days of 
receipt of an Invoice, the applicable Company Group member shall pay the amount 
set forth in
such Invoice, without any reduction for taxes, except as required by any 
Governmental Requirement. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman"><B>4.1.5 </B>If the
applicable Company Group Member is required by any Governmental Requirement to 
deduct or withhold taxes from or in respect of any payments to the applicable 
Transocean Group member under this Agreement, then (i)&nbsp;such Company Group 
Member shall
make such deduction or withholding, (ii)&nbsp;such Company Group Member shall 
pay the full amount deducted or withheld to the appropriate Governmental 
Authority in accordance with such Governmental Requirement, (iii)&nbsp;such 
Company Group Member
shall promptly furnish to such Transocean Group member the original or a 
certified copy of a receipt evidencing such payment, and (iv)&nbsp;the sum 
payable by such Company Group member to such Transocean Group member shall be 
increased by such
additional sums as necessary so that after making all required deductions and 
withholdings of taxes (including deductions and withholdings of taxes applicable
to additional sums payable under this <U>Section&nbsp;4.1.5</U>), such 
Transocean Group
member receives an amount equal to the sum it would have received had no such 
deductions or withholdings of taxes been made. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">10 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1.6</B> The applicable Company
Group member shall be responsible for and
shall indemnify and hold harmless Provider and its Affiliates against all 
excise, sales, use, transfer, stamp, documentary, filing, recordation and other 
similar taxes, and any value added, goods and services or similar recoverable 
indirect and
other similar taxes (&#147;<B>Transfer Taxes</B>&#148;) imposed on or assessed 
as a result of the provision of Services by the applicable Transocean Group 
member. The applicable Transocean Group member shall provide to the applicable 
Company Group
member evidence of the remittance of the amount of such Transfer Taxes to the 
relevant Governmental Authority, including, without limitation, copies of any 
tax returns remitting such amount. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.1.7</B> The Parties shall 
cooperate and take all commercially reasonable actions to minimize withholding 
taxes and
Transfer Taxes imposed on payments made pursuant to this Agreement. </P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-
family:Times New Roman"><B>4.2 <U>Third Party Costs</U>.</B> Notwithstanding
<U>Section&nbsp;4.1.2</U>, in the event that Provider or any Transocean Group 
member incurs costs and expenses (other than taxes described in 
<U>Section&nbsp;4.1.5</U> or <U>Section&nbsp;4.1.6</U>) from third parties in 
the course of subcontracting
the performance of Services hereunder (the &#147;<B>Third Party 
Costs</B>&#148;), such Transocean Group member shall include the amount of those
Third Party Costs, at cost without charging the Services Fee or including any 
other mark-up thereon
unless required by applicable Transfer Pricing Rules (as determined in 
Provider&#146;s reasonable discretion), in the next Invoice and the applicable 
Company Group member shall pay such amounts to the applicable Transocean Group 
member pursuant to
<U>Section&nbsp;4.1.4</U>. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; 
text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>4.3 <U>Discounts
and Benefits</U>.</B> For the avoidance of doubt, in connection with the 
calculation of
the Costs and Expenses or the Third Party Costs hereunder, Provider shall 
disclose and credit to the applicable member of the Company Group, its 
respective share of any discounts, commissions and other benefits received by 
Provider or any of its
employees from third parties as a consequence of the provision of the 
Services.<B> </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-
size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>ARTICLE 5 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times 
New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>INDEMNIFICATION AND EXCULPATION </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.1 <U>Limitation on Remedies</U>. </B>The 
Parties hereby acknowledge and agree that: </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%; 
font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>5.1.1 </B>In the event Provider 
fails to provide a Service (or a portion thereof) in accordance herewith, the 
Company
Group&#146;s sole and exclusive remedy shall be (i)&nbsp;to make a claim for 
indemnification pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.3</U> (if available), (ii)&nbsp;to
have the Service (or relevant portion) reperformed, without having to reimburse 
Provider
for its direct internal cost of such reperformance, (iii)&nbsp;to withhold 
payment for such Service or (iv)&nbsp;to the extent applicable, to have the 
right to terminate the Agreement under <U>Section&nbsp;7.1(c)</U>. The Company 
Group may pursue
more than one remedy at the same time but ultimately may not recover more than
once. Such rights are the Company Group&#146;s sole </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New 
Roman" ALIGN="center">11 </P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; 
font-family:Times New Roman">
remedy for any non-performance, inadequate performance, faulty performance or 
other failure or breach by Provider under or relating to this Agreement. 
E<SMALL>XCEPT</SMALL> <SMALL>AS</SMALL>
<SMALL>SET</SMALL> <SMALL>FORTH</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>FIRST</SMALL> <SMALL>SENTENCE</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> 
<SMALL>THIS</SMALL> <U>S<SMALL>ECTION</SMALL>&nbsp;5.1.1</U>, 
<SMALL>EACH</SMALL> <SMALL>MEMBER</SMALL>
<SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> C<SMALL>OMPANY</SMALL> G<SMALL>ROUP</SMALL>

<SMALL>ANY</SMALL> <SMALL>RIGHT</SMALL> <SMALL>THAT</SMALL> <SMALL>SUCH</SMALL>
<SMALL>MEMBER</SMALL> <SMALL>MAY</SMALL> <SMALL>OTHERWISE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>HAVE</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>CLAIM</SMALL>, 
<SMALL>COLLECT</SMALL> <SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>RECEIVE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>DAMAGES</SMALL>, <SMALL>TO</SMALL>
<SMALL>ENFORCE</SMALL> <SMALL>SPECIFIC</SMALL> <SMALL>PERFORMANCE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OR</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>PURSUE</SMALL> <SMALL>ANY</SMALL> 
<SMALL>OTHER</SMALL> <SMALL>REMEDY</SMALL> <SMALL>AVAILABLE</SMALL> 
<SMALL>IN</SMALL>
